ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat
Review: I bought this for a costume a few months ago and didn't want to review it until after I've worn it for the event so now I can give a more educated review.I carry all my weight around my waist and I normally use L or XL shirts (90% of my t-shirts are Aeropostale so if you fit in a regular US L size that should give you an idea), just to be safe I thought I'd get a XXXL and take it in where needed (easier to remove cloth than add more). As it turns out it fit me just right, so if you're a bigger guy this is definitely not for you. The vest part is not going to forgive any beer belly. That said, there is a reason suits were tailored this way in the past, the coat is cut in a way that it gives a slimming effect around the waist and a bulkier appearance around the shoulders for a nicer V body shape.The coat is a little heavy and thankfully not lined. Because it has a wide collar and it has no lining I could wear this and not get too hot despite being a relatively warm day. The coat felt about the same as if I was wearing a sweatshirt. A little warm but nothing unbearable in a late summer heat.The coatails are a little long and I could feel them hit the back of my boots when I took a step, but I have a long stride. If you wear this outdoors you might get mud on your coat if you're not careful (I'm 5'11 for the record) still they look fine and people said they didn't notice I was kicking them nor did they look ridiculously long as I feared.The arms were a bit long for me, when I bring my arms down the cuff came almost to my knuckles, but I can't fault them for that, it's impossible to get a perfect size on people of all shapes and sizes, just note that if you have short arms you may need to roll them a little or trim them. I intended to shorten them but in the end I went against it since I was tipping my hat for pictures and lifting my hands often holding the syringe so I rarely had my hands down for too long.I'm an amateur tailor, I know my way around sewing machines and I can vouch that the workmanship is pretty good, there were just a couple loose threads here and there but they were just leftovers from after they finished stitching and they cut the thread a little long, i just snipped the loose threads and went on my merry way, nothing was loose or at risk of unraveling, the vest "buttons" are actually snap fasteners and they took quite a beating from me test-wearing the outfit several times as more pieces were ready and yet I never had any issues with them.The label specifically said DarcChic so I can't confirm my review applies to other lookalike products on Amazon.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 16 November 2018

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat
Review: Like many of you reading these reviews, I struggled with determining which size to buy, since individual accounts of the fit vary WILDLY, from "as expected" to "BUY AT LEAST TWO SIZES UP!" So I thought I'd add a detailed personal account of the size Medium. Hopefully it helps someone.I'm a male. 5'9", 170 lbs. My build is slim/athletic. Not skinny or anything, but fairly slim and I like my clothes the same way. This coat was PERFECT in Medium, which is what I typically wear in everything. The shoulder seam hit right at the corner like it's supposed to (and my shoulders are somewhat broad). When I buttoned up the faux vest - the only way this coat fastens - it was not too tight, not too loose. The tails are dramatic - they hit at the mid-calf.As for the material, as others have stated it's similar to a soft denim. Pretty comfy. As a backup I ordered one of those cheap polyester versions of this coat from one of the many generic sellers on here, in case this one didn't fit, but that's going straight back. This one is high quality enough to wear as regular clothes, if I felt like it.Oh, and I got it in the burgundy color, which was, well, burgundy. Or maroon. Purplish-red.Very happy with this. I recommend ordering your normal size in shirts if you're pondering this decision as I did.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 10 October 2021

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat
Review: Husband loved this!!!!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 16 February 2020

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat
Review: I love the look and fit.  The material is denim and is durable.  As coat, the material (denim) does feel a little on the cheap side for this kind of styling.  I would have expected something thicker and of better quality.  With that said, it looks great.  The fit is two sizes small in my opinion.  I wear a large, so I ordered XL, but even that was a bit snug.  I would order two sizes larger if I was to do it again, but the XL works so I'm not going to go through the hassle of returning it and getting the XXL.  I'm 5'7" tall and weight 180 pounds.  I have a slim frame through, but am told, I look solid.  The only thing about the styling that I would change about this coat are the shoulders - they slump.  I expected shoulders to be stiff, straight, and sharp, but when I tried on the coat, they noticeably slump.  Nothing too awful, but takes down the look a notch.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 23 August 2017

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat
Review: Shipping was surprisingly quick. The product is a little "cheaper" looking than we had anticipated. I purchased a large (for a friend) and to see if it would fit him for Christmas, I tried it on. It is a bit small. I'm your average American girl (size 7-8 jeans, measurements 39-27-39, weight 145ish) and it was a bit tight around my bust (friend's chest is smaller than mine so should be okay there), but I expected that. The issue was the shoulders. I have kind of broad shoulders for a girl, but this coat I can barely move my arms around.Even the sellers size chart is off, so pay attention to the comments and what others have said before you pick a size.Secondly, the materials were much cheaper than anticipated. Aside from that, everything was fine. The shipping took around 14 days, and coming from China, that's pretty good (amazon claims it takes nearly a month.)

Review: Folks it’s tight for women in the chest/front side. I bought a large as men’s large polos swim on me and a medium  men’s polo is “just right”, but in this case, it’s designed for a European or Asian framed male which is a “petite” for some Americans. The length is right, the shoulders/upper arms tight, and the button front exactly right or slight split/peak-a-boo area in the chest. If you lift weights or bulk up your upper chest, this will be a size constriction challenge for you. If you’re a long distance runner with a lithe frame this might be too big or bulky for you.

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat
Review: I am 5'3" 220lbs and bought the 4XL size in blue. It's a lot bluer in person than in the picture. It fits well for me, since I am heavy set, and am using it for a Lefou costume, so I like how long it is on me. However, it smells like airesol spray, moth balls, or a really mildew heavy closet. It STINKS !! It smells so bad that when I hung it up (after WASHING it) it stunk my entire room up!

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat
Review: The coat arrived ahead of time, to my surprise. It fit me as expected, being that I looked at the ACTUAL sizing guide. Snaps need a few buttonings and unbuttonings it work well, as with most fresh snaps. Superb, denimesque suiting material construction, with good stitching. Wouldn't load up the pockets, as location could result in bulging or hanging outside the coat. More for a phone or cards/cash. Not really for change. Coat is definitely fitted like a suit, so expect the same limited mobility issues that come with looking pimp i.e. not being able to raise your arms above chest/shoulder level (you can still play guitar way up high and DJ on a keyboard stand just fine though). Not really made for dancing, or constant wear I feel, if this is your look and want to wear it daily it could take it but would need care. Considering getting a second one and chopping the sleeves for a more casual throw-over a fishnet/tanktop look. Stock it is great for costuming and maybe taking to the club. Wouldn't recommend for a formal event, not that kind of tailcoat. It is made for what it is made for and does it well! I use it for gigs and receive frequent compliments, and have used it quite a bit (with moderate abuse) and it has held up just fine. I can also attest to its versatility for those creative in their personal fashion vocabulary. It is best paired with pants of a similar material, but many styles supported here. It can just as easily wear it with a button-up and cravat/bowtie/ascot as I can throw a scarf around it or even rock a printed long sleeve tee and have even ventured to tank top or fishnet shirt. Works amazingly with all. I continue to enjoy this product.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 19 July 2017

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat
Review: 10/10, perfect and reasonable price. This was a relative steal and delivered in mint condition

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat
Review: This coat is quite nice for a costume piece. It does run small, so if you think you are a Large, get an XL or even XXL. The inner vest is actually part of the coat, not separate, and it buttons with snap buttons, which makes it easy to put on. If you don't like the vest, the vest flaps could be pinned back inside the coat using safety pins, and you can then wear your own vest or waistcoat instead (but you'll need to use safety pins or something else to get the vest flaps out of the way). The pockets are real functioning pockets, although not very deep, but I'm still surprised since so many costume coats just have fake pockets. Basically, this coat is a notch above most others costume coats (while still being just a costume coat).
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 1 February 2020

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat
Review: The size chart and lack of mention that vest is attached are the only reasons I'm giving 4 rather than 5 stars.  The jacket is VERY well made and the cloth is very sturdy,durable, thick (kind of like a denim or thick duckcloth).  I am female with a large chest and ordered 2 sizes up from the size chart provided by the seller in their description, and it fit absolutely perfectly!  It's a shame you cannot trust their chart though.  For reference, 2 sizes up is a 10"difference in both chest and waist measurements on my body.  I was a little bummed that the vest is sewn to the jacket, but it does help give a beautiful fit.  I personally plan to remove the vest since I need to for the costume design I plan to use this with.  The tails are quite long and fall just below mid-calf on me (from hipbone to floor my leg is 37").
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 26 May 2017

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat
Review: Looks accurate for the period, mostly cotton, and comfortable to wear.

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat
Review: The fit was great! I'm 5'10, 150lbs and got the small. It fit exactly as I wanted! The tails were not too long for me and the sleeves were just right. However, the jacket is made from a kind of heavy denim-like material so it isn't soft and very nice to the touch like a blazer or sport jacket would be. I was hoping it would have been a bit softer but I suppose that means the jacket will be more rugged and be able to withstand more abuse (not that I'll be trying to find out myself).I bought a separate waist coat to use under it, so I am either going to cut out the jacket's own faux-coat or unsnap the front buttons and pin the two sides back against the inside of the jacket. Either option is very easy to do, if you're wondering, so you can either use the jacket with the faux-waist coat or without it.All in all, a decent jacket but the price is a bit high, for me, for what it's made from. The included faux-waistcoat is a nice touch, in case you want something like that and overall it would be a good option for a vampire, magician, goth, steampunk etc. style costume.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 20 July 2016

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat
Review: I ordered a size large enough to fit my chest and waist, and the vest fits very tight, but the shoulders were falling off my shoulders and the sleeves hung 3" past my hands! The tails of the coat literally drug on the ground three inches in flat shoes. You have to be very tall and thin to have a chance of getting this fit correctly, in my opinion.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 18 October 2022

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat
Review: Its a great jacket for the price. I enjoy wearing it but out of all my jackets its not my first choice. The fabric is thinner than I was hoping for but in turn it makes it pliable. The pockets are thin nylon I believe and have a tendency to stick out. Do not wear this coat on a windy day, because the sides are fastened to the vest, it blows the lapels away revealing that it is all one jacket which I find embarrassing lol. Also the wind will reveal the cheap fabric for the pockets. Once again to reiterate this jacket is pretty cool for the price. Also the snaps easily come undone and because I work out, my pecs pop the top snap off constantly lol.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 7 April 2016

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat
Review: I'm a slender guy with no muscle whatsoever -- 30" waist, 34" chest, 28" sleeve, about 135 pounds, 6 foot tall -- so if I went by the measurements provided in the coat description, a small would be more than big enough for me. After reading the other reviews, though, I went a size up and got a medium. It fits well in the chest but the sleeve are no where near long enough. If I keep my arms down, the sleeves end at my wrists with no slack to spare. If I raise my arms, the sleeves end at about the middle of my forearms. The material and overall quality, however, is very good. Others are correct that the material feels like a very durable denim or canvas. It's not too stiff, though, in my opinion. I would have given this coat 5 stars but because of the sleeves I had to give it 3. I would return it for a large coat instead but I need this for Halloween and it's currently not Prime eligible.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 21 October 2017

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat
Review: Was expecting Halloween costume quality, way better. This is quite a nice coat! Would buy again for sure.

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat
Review: The fit is great.  The fabric is slightly heavier than I expected, but I actually like that.  It does mean anything in warm weather could get extremely hot.  The only thing that takes a star off is the assembly quality.  I can't say stitching because that looks fine, but the fabric panels on the right side of the jacket for the one shipped to me don't line up on the inside and outside, which causes a slight ripple in the fabric of the jacket just above the waist that will not go away no matter what.  Otherwise, it would be five stars.

I ordered a Large going off of all the reviews of it running small.Either you all don't know how to dress, or shop and big and tall becuase I am 5'6" weighing 180lbs with minimal fat (bmi of about 10-12) and this thing was huge on me in the arms and chest when I ordered a large. Almost seems a small would fit.And now it's not on sale and I lost $10. Just follow the chart and don't listen to reviews on this thing.

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat
Review: I'm a tall person, so I purchased the XL knowing it may shrink a little in the wash.  After washing it fit fine except for the sleeves they ended up being a touch too short.  I didn't want to return the coat since I liked it otherwise, so I let out the cuff on the sleeves and rehemmed the cuffs, which gave me about another 1/2 inch on the cuffs.  Would still like a little more sleeve length, but now at least it does look alright in the arms and generally fits well everywhere else.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 15 January 2017

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat
Review: Even though I ordered the jacket two sizes larger (XL) than My normal size (MED) it was still a bit tight. I should have ordered three sizes larger than my norm. I have to get help from my wife or someone else to get my right arm into it after I have inserted my left arm. So, I sprayed it with water and put it on and wore it till it dried on me. Now it is much better.The jacket is a nice cut and fashionable. There is no lining in the jacket. I would have paid a few bucks more for a lining. A lining in a jacket like that protects the inner fabric and also facilitates a more comfortable experience. It is also easier to slip in and out of with a lining. Unlined heavy material is kinda grabby to other fabrics.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 15 January 2017

ProductName: DarcChic Mens Gothic Tailcoat Jacket Black Steampunk VTG Victorian Coat

ProductName: Legendary Whitetails Men's
Review: This checked all the boxes.  I bought this for my brother-in-law for Christmas, and although a few weeks out I have never felt so positive that he is going to love it.  It has a 'lux' look with a traditional plaid interior lining, that BTW is a soft and visually just what you are looking for, making the vest perfect for the woods or that casual dinner engagement. Seriously! This is one good-looking extension to a man's wardrobe -- and there are so many pockets for the outdoors person that needs to keep his phone, keys, and wallet safe, but also the small pocket light, the Leatherman, or whatever else you need to have on your travels into the hinterlands, state and local parks, or whatever floats your favorite love's boat.  But it is also fashionable enough to make your man a Friday night talk of the town :).  I really loved this vest and will be buying it again... just figuring out who is most deserving and will appreciate it for all the finer qualities it presents!  Truly, it is worth the purchase.

ProductName: Legendary Whitetails Men's
Review: I did a lot of research on different websites looking for a vest that I could wear while ranching, fishing, or just for casual wear. Needless to say, prices vary considerably but not necessarily commensurate with quality. I initially found this vest on Legendary Whitetails' website and was impressed by its looks, style  and functionality. When I finally pulled the trigger to purchase it, to my dismay it was sold out in my size. However, I found the same, exact vest available on Amazon in my size (L) and immediately bought it.When I received the vest, I was very pleased to see that its style, appearance and quality met, if not exceeded my expectations. With its flannel lining, it's comfortable and warm but not too heavy. I'm 6' and weigh 175 lbs. and typically wear a size large in most apparel. From a sizing standpoint, I would say that this vest fits true to size (always a concern when ordering online).In summary, I am very pleased with this vest. Really good quality at a very fair price.

Review: I wear a Medium so I bought a Large to be roomy.  Well it is a tight fit w/o a tshirt and too tight with a shirt.  Best to wear it w/o anything underneath. Naked. ProductName: Gihuo Men's Golf Lightweight Photo Vest Fishing Travel Safari Vest
Review: I'm satisfied with it for the moment. My main complaints are it's a bit high priced for the quality of the materials, and it's not as comfortable as I'd hoped it would be; the material's a bit scratchy. That being said, it's light, which is good for summer walks (my intended use), and it fits pretty much right on the money. Would I purchase again? Eh...
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 24 May 2023

ProductName: Gihuo Men's Golf Lightweight Photo Vest Fishing Travel Safari Vest
Review: This item is well made and as described in photos. The zippers appeared to be slightly “underweight” for rigorous outdoor activity but problem free for everyday use. I returned it because while XL usually fits me comfortably, this item was undersized. I purchased a XXL which fit fine. It also extends past the waist to the lower hips so fit is important if you’ll be sitting with it zippered up. Also this vest isn’t insulated so it won’t be similar in function to a light sweater or outdoor fleece vests. In warmer climates & seasons it would be fine. Overall a good value for a lightweight vest.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 29 November 2020

ProductName: Gihuo Men's Golf Lightweight Photo Vest Fishing Travel Safari Vest
Review: This review refers specifically to the basic model with three outside zipper pockets.  I placed four orders to finally get one of acceptable size.  I wear size L for shirts, vests and jackets of almost all brands. I ordered this Guiho vest in size L and received a size S in a package labeled L; the size tag had been cut out.  I ordered L again (in a different color) and received size M in a package labeled L; again no size tag.  A size XXL was too big.  Finally a size XL was satisfactory, though a bit too large.  So I have not seen a true size L.  Both the XXL and the XL had size tags.  I think the seller ran out of size L and so deceptively put smaller sizes in packages labeled L. Colors are not as pictured: the “army green” is an ugly dark greenish brown; kakhi is more yellowish brown than shown, but satisfactory.  The overall quality seems satisfactory, though I have not yet tested it for durability.  It is annoying that the zipper pull is on the left side.  The one inside pocket in the XL is barely big enough to hold a US passport; pockets are smaller in smaller sizes.  Follow up:  The vest gave satisfactory service for a week of traveling abroad.  My main complaint is about the deceptive sizing.  It could be improved by adding a large inside pocket big enough to carry a Kindle or a travel guide book.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 25 October 2019

ProductName: Gihuo Men's Golf Lightweight Photo Vest Fishing Travel Safari Vest
Review: I almost always wear a vest over a shirt or T-shirt as a "fat- hider". I have a green one I like, but decided to get a second one. The one I originally bought on Amazon is not for sale anymore. I don't need a dozen pockets, just one for glasses and two side pockets for keys, etc. This vest has that. I originally bought a khaki one, but decided I didn't like the color on me so am returning. I replaced it with a gray one of the same mfr as the khaki.No mileage so far to address durability. The reverse zipper is odd, but I have that on a down coat from France, and I don't zip up very often anyway.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 13 May 2021

ProductName: Gihuo Men's Golf Lightweight Photo Vest Fishing Travel Safari Vest
Review: I love this style and color. It's light and airy and keeps you cool while looking like a camper. Also it's got pockets.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 8 July 2023

ProductName: Gihuo Men's Golf Lightweight Photo Vest Fishing Travel Safari Vest
Review: On the plus side. It fits good, works great as a kind of winder breaker for the body. Looks great too. The cell phone pocket on the left chest is actually the right size to fit a smart phone. Other vests I have tried were obviously made for old smaller cell phones and too small for modern smart phones. Now the bad. The nylon shell is very thin and not very rugged. I have only had this a short time and there is already a small hole right over the cell phone pocket. The nylon is so fragile that all you have to do is rub up against something while you have a cell phone in the pocket and it wears a hole in the nylon almost immediately. So on the one hand I want to recommend this for all the good points, but at the same time discourage people from getting it due to the fragility of the materials.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 19 July 2019

ProductName: ZENTHACE Men's Warm Sherpa Lined Fleece Plaid Flannel Shirt Jacket(All Sherpa Fleece Lined)
Review: I live in a area of Southern Australia that is hot, hot, hot in Summer and very cold in Winter. This jacket is perfect for our cold nights which are around around freezing. Would not suit artic temperatures. Having said that I am very pleased with this jacket. It is a perfect fit, warm but it will still allow for layering and it has the bonus of side pockets which not all jackets of this type possess. Delivery process was super fast (order placed 11 July and received today 22nd) and having free returns gives peace of mind. (I have ordered a different brand jacket as well as this and sizing was guesswork with much disagreement in reviews about fit.) So if you are thinking of buying this jacket, order the size you usually take and I'd be amazed if you didn't like your purchase.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Australia on 22 July 2021

ProductName: ZENTHACE Men's Warm Sherpa Lined Fleece Plaid Flannel Shirt Jacket(All Sherpa Fleece Lined)

ReviewDate: Reviewed in Germany on 28 December 2023

ProductName: ZENTHACE Men's Warm Sherpa Lined Fleece Plaid Flannel Shirt Jacket(All Sherpa Fleece Lined)
Review: Innanzitutto l'articolo corrisponde perfettamente alla descrizione, cosa assolutamente non scontata.L'esterno è in pile super morbido, l'interno una pelliccetta sintetica anch'essa estremamente morbida.I colori rispecchiano la foto dell' inserzione: io ho preso un tono su tono di grigi ed è una combinazione molto gradevole che non fa sembrare la camicia un prodotto da bancarella cinese.Il taglio è regolare e non fa l'effetto "sacco di patate" ma piuttosto segue la forma del corpo; corretta la lunghezza delle maniche.Attenzione alle misure: veste grande. Io sono 1.75 per circa 80 kg con fisico robusto e la taglia giusta è la M.Le tasche per le mani sono ampie e all' interno rivestite in caldo pile.Le tasche frontali sono piuttosto piccole.È un capo caldo ma non caldissimo: per temperature attorno allo zero bisogna mettere in conto almeno una termica sotto e un giubbotto sopra. È una camicia pesante, non una giacca imbottita.Soddisfatto dell' acquisto.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Italy on 2 February 2024

ProductName: ZENTHACE Men's Warm Sherpa Lined Fleece Plaid Flannel Shirt Jacket(All Sherpa Fleece Lined)
Review: I purchased two different versions of this by the same brand. The only difference is this one is a button front and the other one is a snap front. Same exact quality, material and fit. Very soft inside. Good quality material. It's not thin junk. One thing I found interesting that you need to take into consideration is that Amazon suggested that I wear a large in this model yet the exact same thing with the snap front they suggested I wear a medium. I ordered large in both and both fit perfectly. I can see the button closure being nice for a shirt but I found that the snap is much more convenient for a jacket for a quick on and off. This one was $10 cheaper but I would rather pay the extra money for the snap in the future. The only negative about the whole thing is the hip pockets are set back too far so it makes them difficult to reach in quickly. You have to feel around towards the back to find & reach them. It was a good buy. Hard to find insulated flannels anymore. These kept me warm in 30° temperatures. Perfect Fall or early Winter jacket.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 13 November 2023

ProductName: ZENTHACE Men's Warm Sherpa Lined Fleece Plaid Flannel Shirt Jacket(All Sherpa Fleece Lined)

ProductName: ZENTHACE Men's Warm Sherpa Lined Fleece Plaid Flannel Shirt Jacket(All Sherpa Fleece Lined)
Review: Hola, la adquirí en primavera 2023, ya con algo de calor, espere a que bajara un poco y así fue que la compre; cabe mencionar que mido 1.70, peso 68 kilos, poca panza y hombros caídos, pedí talla chica, al ponérmela me quedo ligeramente grande (menos que talla M), pensé de inmediato, la mando ajustar y listo!, pero viendo que no es tan caliente, mejor poniéndome debajo una camiseta (algodón o térmica), camisa y un suéter o sudadera, me quedaría mejor y lucio mucho mejor; al tacto por fuera y por dentro se sienten muy ricas, mi preocupación que encogiera por ser como franela por fuera y para nada (la lave dos veces para verificar) y aparte no se arruga y casi no es necesario plancharle, cabe mencionar que donde vivo es Toluca Méx, el invierno es rudo y si pienso salir con una camisa y la chamarra la pasaría mal. Si usas prendas talla Chica en la marca Dockers, RL o Tommy (todas regular), te quedara bien, o como a mi ligeramente pero muy ligero grande; en mi caso no fue problema porque a veces así vienen las sudaderas tipo chamarra. Lo único malo es que se nota que para ahorrar en la maquila, las bolsas están a la altura de la costura de las costillas y eso da como resultado que están atrás las bolsas, pero de allí en fuera se acepta la prenda. Me volvería a comprar siiiiii, en mi caso sería en colores sobrios y lisos, están padres la tipo leñador pero cada quien sus gustos.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Mexico on 22 April 2023

ProductName: ZENTHACE Men's Warm Sherpa Lined Fleece Plaid Flannel Shirt Jacket(All Sherpa Fleece Lined)
Review: I work in a refrigerated warehouse but don't need long sleeves under it, and I hate the feeling of the typical nylon lining in most sleeves. This is the perfect solution to that, I can throw it on over a t shirt without needing a buffer layer. The colours look great (photographed against a hi-viz safety vest), it's soft, I don't have any immediate concerns about durability, but I'd probably buy it again just for the sleeves if something did happen to it.

ProductName: ZENTHACE Men's Warm Sherpa Lined Fleece Plaid Flannel Shirt Jacket(All Sherpa Fleece Lined)
Review: I absolutely love this coat. leaving it open, it breathes enough that in mild weather it never feels overly warm. As soon as you button it up though it creates an incredibly cozy little bubble of your body heat. The ONLY downside is the pockets. They feel a bit far back when buttoned up, but on the inside, there is only a small string connecting the bottom of the pocket to the coat. I could see it very easily getting snagged on something and once torn, the pocket will likely sag below the bottom of the jacket and look silly. I think in a future edition, it would be wise to sew the pocket onto the inside of the coat somehow. It would really make it feel much higher quality.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 23 December 2023

ProductName: Cutter & Buck Clique Men's Summit Full-Zip Microfleece
Review: It’s a great value. It is, hands down, the absolute, most average fabric and the cut is extremely middle of the road, but it’s essentially exactly what I wanted. You’ll love it. I bought it to fit under a denim trucker jacket and/or to be used as a house jacket. It’s great for either. I am 6’2” and about 190 and the medium is the right size for me. I first bought a large and it was really loose on me. Amazon has a pre-configured return protocol for people who buy the wrong size, so they already put the medium in the mail before I had wrapped up the large to be returned. Very efficient. The medium arrived with an air freshener fragrance, which I assume is what they do when someone returns one and they plan to send it back out. The large had no smell. I just washed it before wearing; you have to admire that they have such a robust system for returns. They can’t just throw them out because they didn’t fit. I’ll probably buy another one since it doesn’t make sense to have a sweatshirt that you’d use to wear around the house AND out on the mean streets of suburbia.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 4 May 2021

ProductName: Cutter & Buck Clique Men's Summit Full-Zip Microfleece

ProductName: Cutter & Buck Clique Men's Summit Full-Zip Microfleece
Review: I have only worn it a few times, but it’s a nice fit. I wanted something to use as almost a sweater, to throw on for a chilly morning or a restaurant with the A/C too high. It works perfectly for those conditions.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 12 May 2023

ProductName: Cutter & Buck Clique Men's Summit Full-Zip Microfleece
Review: I've tried 6 different zipper sweaters, and began to wonder if I was just too crazy-fussy.  This has reassured me of my sanity!  This is what I wanted.  It is soft, particularly important around the neck when the sweater has a full-length zipper.  The XL size was perfect for me (190 lbs, 6 foot, average build, with a medium-weight shirt or sweatshirt underneath.  It has a good waist length (as pictured in the ad) and good circumference for me (I have a 38" waist).  The sleeves are not overly long; rolled up once at the cuffs was perfect.  Blue color was a dark navy blue.  The zipper was sturdy, and pulls up on the right side.  (Several of the sweaters I tried were described as "Men's" but the zipper pulled up on the left, woman's, side by U.S. custom.)  It is medium weight, so I can wear it around the house or outside if I feel a bit chilly.  It is not really warm or heavy for colder weather.  It has two deep zipper pockets. The price of $25 was very reasonable.  Yes, I'm happy I found this.  I will follow the washing instructions (machine wash cold; dry low) because I want this to last.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 20 March 2017

ProductName: Cutter & Buck Clique Men's Summit Full-Zip Microfleece
Review: Just right for going to AC restaurants and church.

I covered my bases & ordered a 3x & 4x to see what would fit best since reviews & size chart were not helpful. I ended up sending the 3x back because the 4x fits more like a 3x. So this jacket definitely runs on the smaller side. The length isn’t bad, for most it would seem average length and material is light but warm. The husband is happy with his new jacket & it’s his favorite color.

I fori per le braccia sembrano due fori ricavati da una federa o da un sacchetto di carta. La forma generale è esattamente quella: foro ricavato da un sacchetto di carta. Ho comprato il gilet per lavorare, ma gli strani fori per le braccia gli danno una brutta sensazione.

ProductName: Dickies Men's Diamond Quilted Nylon Vest

ProductName: Dickies Men's Diamond Quilted Nylon Vest
Review: Gilet matelassé très agréable à porter avec sa doublure en polaire fine, y compris dans les poches.D'ailleurs, ces dernières sont vastes et larges et permettent de contenir beaucoup en plus de vos mains.Fermeture éclaire de bonne qualité.Matière souple qui permet d'éviter l'effet "gilet de sauvetage" quand on s'assied ou que l'on se penche.Dommage qu'il ne soit pas décliné en d'autres coloris.Histoire de critiquer : pour du work wear, je le vois mal utilisé sur un chantier....
ReviewDate: Reviewed in France on 5 December 2016

ProductName: Dickies Men's Diamond Quilted Nylon Vest
Review: Good vest fits well wish it was a bit longer in length but still keep me warm and dru love the large front pockets

ProductName: Dickies Men's Diamond Quilted Nylon Vest
Review: I purchased this vest for my husband who has been working outdoors on  a construction site. I did purchase one size bigger so it would fit comfortably overtop of a undershirt, T-shirt and a  thick hoodie. Could probably even fit overtop of his light jacket. The vest has large wide open arm holes so I guess it was actually designed to fit overtop of a light jacket..This vest is very well made. The back of it goes a bit lower I guess to cover some of the lower back  &  butt area. The front pouch style pockets are wide and deep and fleece lined.. Would easily fit a phone and other items. The inside lining is lightly padded and lining is a soft T-shirt type fabric that likely holds body heat. The outer shell of the vest is a thicker type of nylon that likely breaks wind. The zipper is sturdy and seems to be good quality zipper. The fabrics have that quilted stitching. My husband likes it very much and says its the best vest he has ever had / worn..Very well made. Well worth every penny. Made in Bangledesh - no NOT  cheap china made.I would purchase again and recommend this vest for anyone who needs a good vest for working outdoors.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on 29 November 2023

ProductName: Dickies Men's Diamond Quilted Nylon Vest
Review: excellent vest workin outside
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on 2 April 2021

ProductName: Dickies Men's Diamond Quilted Nylon Vest

ProductName: Dickies Men's Diamond Quilted Nylon Vest
Review: Light Dickies vest that has some deep but not too deep front pockets. Warm enough to wear casually around the house or during the Spring/ Fall seasons. I purchased mine at XXL so I could add layers underneath. Collar is akin to a flight jacket. One minor gripe was the lower part of the zipper was loose from the vest which was easily remedied with some thread and needle.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 29 January 2023

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: Originally I ordered a large size jacket being that I am a size medium. I was going with the rule “always go one size up with jackets and coats”.  With these jackets, I would not use that rule at all.  The jacket was WAY too big on me and I had i return this hack via UPS and get a refund minus the shipping cost.Now that I have this medium size jacket, it fits almost how expected the jacket to fit.  The chest area could be a little wider, but over all, I like it.Now I live in Central Texas, it might get as cold as 30 degrees Fahrenheit, but normally not colder than that.  It keeps me warm.  It breaks the wind quite well too.  It rained today, it held up pretty good and I stayed dry.  However, I was only going from my house or store to my car.Now I’m originally from the northeastern part of the U.S.  it’s colder there and we get snow.  I would use this jacket as a spring or fall jacket in a colder climate.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 31 December 2020

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: 5XL 250lb, 5’8”, great fit, very roomy. Perfect weight for SoCal winters, nice soft lining. We’ll constructed. Happy with jacket.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 11 September 2023

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: Material Not what I expected when I open the package, but it does keep you warm and looks good wearing it.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 14 November 2023

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: The jacket is as advertised, but the zipper is on the wrong side.  My wife didn't know what I was talking about until I showed her my other coats and her coats. Men's zippers are on the right-hand side and women's the left.  This jacket has a left-hand zipper.  Now the zipper works just fine. The coat seems well constructed, but it just feels wrong when I go to zip or unzip.I would have given it 5 stars, but the zipper thing is a standard that has been on every man's coat or jacket I have ever had.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 29 December 2023

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: The coat cost 50.00 & I paid 72.00 due to shipping! Not happy about that.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 26 November 2023

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: I am roughly 5'11" and would wear a 3xl T-Shirt.. The upper back is pretty tight for me and so is the chest and stomach area but that could be just an issue of me being a bigger guy and shaped different. It did do its job as a windbreaker and it also did keep me warm. The whole reason why I am writing this though other than the size issue that others have warned about, which is resolved if you buy one size larger. Is the problem with warranty and support. I reached out to Pro Club through their website for support after the jacket ripped and the rep said they didnt' offer support for their products sold on Amazon. Even if you were to look at their website it looks like there isn't any warranty available on their products. I was just outside of the return policy as well. If you can get these jackets for cheap then i would say go for it but otherwise I'd stay away.Pros:- Keeps you warm- does its job as a windbreakerCons:- Smaller than advertised size[buy one size larger]- No warranty outside of return policy
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 16 November 2023

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: Liked the fit very much.  The lining was very nice, too.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 10 August 2023

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: While I will get lots of use out of this jacket here in Austin, TX.  The fleece lining is actually slightly excessive.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 16 November 2023

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: I ordered the 5xl big and tall, the 5xl was not branded tall anywhere on it. I wear a 4xlt shirt. Bought the next size up due to description saying it run small. Jacket fits like a 3xl jacket. Imagine the jacket as the sausage jacket and me as the stuffing, all of my glorious lumps and mounds highlighted for the world to see.Yes zipper is on the left, it’s mentioned in the description, big whoop.In the description it said made in USA, tag clearly says made in China.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 14 January 2024

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: This is  the second such jacket I bought. The first jacket's left side pocket was left unfinished/unsewn . One's hand goes through the pocket because the bottom of the pocket was not sewn closed. Luckily, I can sew, so I went ahead and completed the work so I could have a pocket I could actually use. This is the only reason why I took off one star from the rating. The jacket is actually well made and the material is good. The fit is even better. I sized up because I like a loose jacket. I am a size 4 miss, but I ordered a medium. I like the jacket so much, I ordered a second one and the second one is perfect. The jacket is very comfortably warm.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 12 March 2022

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: Technically a "lined windbreaker", but actually warmer than those words imply.  I really like the fit and the style/look, this is my go-to outer wear for everything except the coldest of weather.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 20 February 2023

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: This jacket is a little thinner than I thought it was going to be because the sleeves don't have the inner layer of warmth/ Fleece lined. Other than that it is good.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 14 December 2022

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: I ordered this jacket for my father. The only complaint he has is that the zipper is on the opposite side from any jacket he currently owns so it makes it difficult to zip up. He also has some vision impairment and that makes it a little more difficult. Otherwise, the jacket is warmer than the one he currently owned and it meets the need.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 9 February 2023

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: I like the fleece lining not to hot and not cold. I got this jacket to wear to work on them not to cold days because I work the loading docks and it was just what I was looking for. years ago you used to be able to buy these jackets in store but not anymore that's the downside of ordering online you can't see it in person but like I said it's just what I was looking for
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 18 October 2022

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: Good quality for the price, comfortable, nice fall jacket as well.

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: I had to order XL for the longer arms. Leaves my middle with a little extra material fat belly space for me. The hoodie could fit a large head & probably a baseball cap. As is it covers my eyes if I want. But overall a decent jacket. I just don't understand the gay reversing of the front zipper like on women's clothing.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 10 July 2021

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: Bought this for my son who is 6'6" and weighs around 270. Normally he wears a XXL but after reading reviews I ordered 3XL - it is a perfect fit. It is a nice weight for spring !
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 26 March 2022

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: The first clue that something is amiss with this jacket is that the zipper pull is on the left side.  This is extremely unusual for men's clothing which normally buttons or zips from the right, but women's clothing usually fastens from the left.  The proportions are also a bit screwy, particularly the shoulders which were too tight.  Women tend to have narrower shoulders than men.  It's almost as if they took a jacket pattern that was made for women and just scaled up the size to fit men rather than redesign the jacket from scratch.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 30 November 2021

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: The zipper is reversed which may make it difficult for some people to engage and zip......if you are use to the zipper connector being on the right side, don't buy this jacket.....the zipper connector is on the left side.....weird.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 23 December 2022

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: Not made in USA

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: Let me be clear, the reason the jacket is too small is because it's not a windbreaker. It has the flannel lining on the inside which took up the extra space, that would make it a windbreaker.At this point it's no longer a windbreaker, because of its flannel lining it's a jacket and they did not increase the size to accommodate for the flannel which makes it too small, because it's not a windbreaker,  I know of no windbreaker with a thick lining in my lifetime of 55 years. And I have purchased many windbreakers.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 16 September 2018

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket
Review: Ordered one for myself and one for husband.  Loved the jackets -- windy where we walk and sometimes after dark.  Mine broke where the zipper pull slides, completely broke out 2nd time I put it on.  Returned for credit with no problem.  Finally decided to try again.  Husband loves his.  It had one problem which turned out to be fine.  The hang tag said 2X, but sewn in tag said 3X.  Definitely a 3X and works fine. Gives him a little space to layer. Would give 5 star if hadn't had problem.

ProductName: Pro Club Fleece Lined Windbreaker Jacket

Not disappointed because I expected it to be light. I do still wish it was a little heavier though. Beats any typical windbreaker with no insulation.

I use it at my security job and feel confident it will keep me warm when the temp drops to the 40’s and has enough room for a liner for extra warmth. I would buy it again.

ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 19 April 2023

ProductName: TRAILSIDE SUPPLY CO. Men's Softshell Fleece-Lined Jackets/Winter Outdoor Coats/Windbreaker/Medium-Weight Water-Repellent
Review: I was looking for a plain jacket to use for my AEMT class and the clinicals I need to take for it. And given it is winter here I needed a jacket quick. This is lightweight and soft on the outside and very easy to move around in. No pulling on my shoulders or upper arms like other jackets do. Plenty of space in the pockets to carry my things like my stethoscope, pens, medications, and back up supplies I need to have close to me when I travel out that will not clutter up my go bag.The velcro tightening pieces on the wrists are stretchy enough for me to pull my sleeves up  on my arms incase I need to keep cloth out of the way for what I need to do. With the pockets it is a bit higher up on my torso,the bottom of the pocket the zipper did cut my fingertip and through the white of my fingernail when I pushed my  hand into the pocket to grab something. It may have been my fault on that but I wanted to make note of that . Overall I love this jacket and I hope it will last a long time during my school into my job life. And I can even wear it as a regular jacket by removing my velcro patches from my shoulders.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 23 February 2021

ProductName: TRAILSIDE SUPPLY CO. Men's Softshell Fleece-Lined Jackets/Winter Outdoor Coats/Windbreaker/Medium-Weight Water-Repellent
Review: Going through all the jackets available to choose from was quite a chore.  I narrowed my list down to this jacket and the Columbia Ascender Softshell Jacket (https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00HQ4KSMI).  They seemed pretty similar although the Columbia jacket was $11 more expensive.  I decided to order both and then choose.These jackets are virtually identical.  Here's the differences I spotted:1. The cuff on this Trailside jacket has elastic as well as velco cuff.  The Columbia jacket just has the velcro.  The problem with only the velcro cuff is that you either strap and unstrap the velcro whenever you put it on and take it off, or you live with the cuff wide enough to get it on and off and accept it the cold air from the poor fit when you wear it.  The combination of velcro and elastic cuff on this jacket solves this problem.2. The zipper on the Columbia jacket was quite stiff.  So stiff that you need to use two hands to zip or unzip it.  The Trailside jacket has an easy smooth zipper.3. The emblem.  The Columbia jacket has their name emblazoned, whereas the Trailside emblem looks like the edge of a mountain ridge.4. The Trailside comes in a "ziplock" like bag.  The Columbia in a thinner resealable bag (making it awkward to get the jacket in and out past the sticky edges).5. The price of the Trailside is better.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 30 October 2020

ProductName: TRAILSIDE SUPPLY CO. Men's Softshell Fleece-Lined Jackets/Winter Outdoor Coats/Windbreaker/Medium-Weight Water-Repellent
Review: I needed a lightweight jacket for fall and spring, and the Trailside brand doesn't disappoint. I'm not trying to make a fashion statement, just needed something to keep out the chill and serve as a shell in wind/light rain. This jacket does this perfectly.

ProductName: TRAILSIDE SUPPLY CO. Men's Softshell Fleece-Lined Jackets/Winter Outdoor Coats/Windbreaker/Medium-Weight Water-Repellent
Review: Fit as expected, but one of the inside pockets was ripped a little, and I am not the person who has time to resend things normally.  Thankfully a tailor in town repaired it at a fair price, but I really wish the pockets were much stronger from the start.  The hand pockets are not as large as I was expecting and could not fit my beats headphones case.  There are a couple pockets on the inside that work with it though.  The short answer, would I buy it again?  Yes.  It's seems to be very well,  I just really wish the pockets were reinforced better.  The pocket in question was the top zipper pocket.  It had a hole in its corner on the inside, letting things drop through it.  It's a very essential pocket to me, which is another reason I had it repaired asap.

Review: I like this as an everyday, around town jacket. The cuffs are great, with velcro and elastic they are tight and easy to get on and off. At this price and weight it is not an extreme weather jacket--I would not want to go work or play in the fields on a cold day (windy and < 45F) in this jacket.

ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 23 June 2023

ProductName: TRAILSIDE SUPPLY CO. Men's Softshell Fleece-Lined Jackets/Winter Outdoor Coats/Windbreaker/Medium-Weight Water-Repellent
Review: In general I like the fit, feel and weight.  But there are no chest pockets.  There is no good place for a cell phone/wallet or etc.  The upper arm pockets are ok.  The lower back "map" pocket is ok.  But there is no chest pocket which is a really glaring deficiency.  The liner of the hand pockets is stitched on the inside (on both sides of the jacket) in such a way as to make a very deep very narrow pocket where the inside chest pocket should be.  But this is so deep and narrow as to be virtually useless.  A small phone or small wallet could fit inside but getting anything other than a very small hand in there to dig it out would require a near contortionist.  Too bad because otherwise I would be really happy with this Jacket.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 5 August 2021

ProductName: TRAILSIDE SUPPLY CO. Men's Softshell Fleece-Lined Jackets/Winter Outdoor Coats/Windbreaker/Medium-Weight Water-Repellent
Review: I love this jacket!! I never take the time to to do reviews but I seriously felt like it was necessary with this one. It needed a few shrinks in the wash and dryer to get it to my specific liking as far as a more snug fit since it is a men’s jacket, but besides that.. no complaints really. When I first zipped it up when I tried it on, the zipper did a weird thing and SPLIT on me.. but it only happened once and I’m hoping it doesn’t do it again. So far it hasn’t. Seems like this jacket is made of pretty good quality for the price. I dig it. Oh, I do recommend that you buy a size up (that was the jacket can last longer anyway) though. I did, and I’m really grateful for it because it can begin to shrink after a few drys if you use high heat like I do.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 9 November 2019

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Super bequeme Jacke
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Germany on 8 February 2024

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Love the coat, HATE the size. I bought, tried, and returned a 3X-tall, and a 5X-regular. 3X was too small, and the sleeves were too short. 5X was too large and the sleeves were THE SAME LENGTH as the 3X. If you have long arms, be wary.  Also, don't rip open the package that it comes in thinking it's going to fit like I did. Now I have to buy something to return the first coat in. I was careful with the second coat packaging, so I can use that for the return of the 2nd.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 28 August 2018

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Great coat! It is heavy enough for 30- 40degree days and with a layer of two perfectly fine for those colder days!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 14 September 2018

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: As mentioned the hood is HUGE and no drawstrings. That's about the only serious problem. Fit's well and is warm. Not over heavy. The sanded duck finish is nice. Not as harsh as a carhart style coat. Very comfortable - sitting as well as standing. I would recommend ordering bigger than you think you'll need. I did and it fits great. Love the sherpa lining.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 14 December 2016

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Great coat.  Hard to find Dickies products where I live (I find them to be longer lasting than many modern Carhartt products, unless you pay for top end Carhartt).Not too thick/ bulky but very warm.  Is now my favorite coat.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 25 November 2016

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Excelente Calidad
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Mexico on 20 January 2024

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Did not like material of shell not tough enough and cut small !
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 20 October 2018

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: I bought my son, who has a big frame and a long torso, this jacket for hunting and snow plowing and it is a perfect fit. The sleeves are nice and long too as everything I buy him has short arms. My son said the inside lining is very warm. The price was right for my budget. Buy it! You'll love it.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 25 December 2016

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Jacket is very comfortable. Fits great too!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 16 January 2017

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: very good quality and warmer than I expected; the hood is a real plus other makers don't have
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 7 March 2016

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Jacket fits as expected, nice warm lining.  The only thing lining was hanging lower than jacket.....good thing I sew I fixed the mistake.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on 31 August 2019

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: It's in a decent quality for the price. He was not thrill with it but comfort enough to throw it on in the morning.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 14 March 2014

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Fits great, really warm... The hood is a bit large, but I suspect it's for people wearing knitted caps or hard hats... would be better if the hood was detachable and/or adjustable with strings, but I can live with it.... The cell phone pocket won't even come close to holding my Galaxy S4, maybe if this were 5 years ago and I was till using a flip phone, it would have a purpose...Cuffs fit snug, but not too snug, and it is really warm... great work coat, especially if I'm working indoors, I don't have to dress in tons of layers to stay warm when I go in and out. Just throw this coat on and I'm good to go, take just the coat off when I come back in..
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 24 November 2014

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Good fit. Hood is huge, it makes my big dome look tiny in it, and also very warm
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 6 January 2015

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Excelente calidad como siempre, tal vez si viene un poco corta de las mangas y efectivamente la gorra es algo grande pero es muy abrigadora
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Mexico on 17 October 2022

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Nice work jacket. My guys like it.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on 23 February 2018

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: very close to perfect.  One small manufacturers defect though.  One of the stitching lines is not 100% straight, resulting in the zipper rubbing a small hole in some seam beading.  I fixed it with a little fishing line and a heavy duty upholstery needle.  Spot that rubbed was less than 1cm long, so I only took one star off.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on 16 November 2016

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: WOW! this jacket is really heavy and certainly keeps you warm. Being in the south it actually is a bit too heavy. But is great for the few weeks we have of bitter cold weather.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 11 June 2015

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Jacket is exactly how it was described.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 20 October 2016

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: This jacket has a great classic look and has kept me warm working in the 20s the last week. I've already received several compliments on the jacket's appearance and warmth. The elastic-free waist line looks better and is more comfortable than elastic. The sleeves and waist in size Large Tall are long enough for my longish arms and torso. The hood is bigger than that of any coat I've owned before and keeps out the wind very effectively. The zipper is solid and joins the hood at the top to cover your chin. The duck outer has apparently been very thoroughly "sanded" and is softer than those of other duck jackets i've owned. I believe it is still pretty durable but only time can tell. The Olive Black color is darker and slightly browner than pictured, a nice shade that will fade gracefully. The jacket is perfect and I hope it lasts a while.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 22 November 2014

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: very good
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 11 February 2016

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: little short
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 13 July 2014

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: It is a decent jacket for now, but after a week of using it, the jacket has a tear. The tear is on the seam with the hood.  I noticed it on the second week after buying it. The tear is by the seam between the hood and the rest of the jacket. It's disappointing, but thankfully the jacket keeps me warm.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 21 April 2023

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: This coat was bought as a work coat to withstand Frigid temperatures. It was first bought in an 3 XL REG and it was too big then it was bought in an 2 XLB and this one is pretty fitted with a T-shirt and hoodie. The coat was worn in -11 degrees and heavy winds and it stood up very well! The hood is over sized but not problematic. All and all a good purchase. He loves it!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 29 January 2019

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Nice jacket. Famous Dicky quality. I'm 6'  170 lbs. With long arms . and 32 waist. I bought large tall. fits a hair big on arms. The elastic wrists fit snug keeps sleeves from sliding over hands. 32 waist fits good  .34 might be snug. Also hangs down to crotch. Draw back the hood is very big will hang down in front of your eyes. Made for giant headed people.wearing a ball cap under hood helps. Not sure if just a large would fit better than large tall. I am extremely happy with this coat. Nice and warm also.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 18 January 2015

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: This is the best fitting coat I have ever had, very nice looking, and kept mewarm the one time I wore it. Unfortunately it ripped the first time I took it off. It ripped dead center….top of the coat where the hood connects to coat. It ripped vertically…both the hood and the coat.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 2 December 2022

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: It will keep you warm, its easy to wash.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 6 August 2023

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Nice quality coat - very warm and appears pretty durable.  Only complaint is it's pretty short wasted...wish it was 2-3 inches longer, and that applies to all sizes - I purchased a number of these in various sizes for our employees.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 17 April 2023

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Let me start by saying I REALLY like this jacket. It is soft and very warm, and the lining not being in the sleeves is not an issue. I think if the Sherpa lining were in the sleeves, it would be hard to get on and off. I have an unlined Carhartt jacket and I like this much more than my Carhartt. The Carhartt is so bulky and stiff it's very uncomfortable and I don't wear it much. This one, though big, is not really bulky and not stiff at all. I only gave 4 stars due to some sizing issues. I am a female and I usually wear a 2x but I ordered a 3x bc I wanted this to be loose. It is not very loose and I am glad I went up a size.  It is very tight around my hips when zipped. The sleeves however are really loose. They fall down over my hands even when snapped on the tightest snap, and I have large hands. However, it is so comfortable I don't really care about the sizing issues much. It is not flattering at all, but for a country girl hanging out at bonfires that doesn't matter to me.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 9 December 2016

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: I ordered this just before we got hit with a long and drawn out winter season here in KY.  Glad I did, the jacket has held up beautifully and kept me warm many cold days.  My only wish is that they offered this jacket in a slightly larger size.  I ordered the largest they had (5X) and it fits, but is just a bit tight.  I am a big dude and have a hard time finding clothing that fits and still has a reasonable price (I know there are tons of big and fat stores, but most things are way overpriced for us big fellas - or maybe I'm just spoiled coming from a small southern town where things are just different from where I am now).Overall I am satisfied with the jacket, it's a bit small but I can fit and zip it all the way with no real trouble.  It is very warm and not too heavy.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 13 February 2014

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: It's absolutely  perfect for snow and wind.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 9 March 2023

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Jacket feels warm and durable. I just wish it was a little longer. If I bend over, I know I'll feel a draft going up my back.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 2 March 2022

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Got a long for the first time because they were out of the regular fit. Was a little nervous since I'm not quite 6ft tall. Its not noticably long and I think the extra length will be great for say bending over and getting that nasty draft up your back. The extra sleeve length is more fabric to keep your arms warm. I would buy this again although it seems pretty tough. I do concrete so I shred cloths up pretty fast. Great price for the product. Also.. i think they fixed that giant hood issue because mine isn't big like the ones displayed here.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 5 October 2020

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Great fit. I'm 6'4" tall and weigh 185 lbs. I just have an issue with the fabric wanting to stall the zipper in one spot. I have figured out that pulling outward on the zipper in that short area I can easily zip the jacket up. The hood is larger than on any other jacket I have owned, but I wear a baseball or trucker's style hat so it's not a big deal. Also the hood does not have any draw strings but seems to be ok if the jacket is zipped all the way.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 21 February 2017

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Purchased this jacket for my husband who works outside throughout the winter cutting wood and clearing brush.  I was looking for a field-type jacket that was like a Carhartt, but less stiff and more wearable.  This was it.  The fit was on the money, the length was good, and there are many pockets (which my husband loves).
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 13 July 2020

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Absolutely more than expected! Definitely quality for the money!We bought 2!My husband and i use as our heaviest coat fir camping and other activities!I love it on him so i when 1 st order was too small for him . I fell in love with it so instead of a return we spent another $150 .Best coat investment!!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 19 May 2021

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: I first purchased a standard Large b/c I feared the Large Tall would be too long.  After receipt the sleeves of the standard Large were too short so I immediately returned it and ordered a Large Tall.  The torso length of the Large Tall is good but the sleeves are still too short as they leave my wrists and slightly above exposed when driving a vehicle, etc.  I'm 6'0" tall, 190 lbs, 32" waste.  My other jackets are standard Large and do not have this same sleeve length issue.  Also the jacket I received has a bizzare odor that I cannot get rid of.  Right out of the box it smelled and that eve I hung it in our coat closet and now several other coats have that same smell.  I've washed this coat twice, treated with Fabreeze which helps mask the foul odor.  But after the Fabreeze dissapates it smells bad again.  It hangs in my cube at work and makes my cube area smell, and co-workers complain.  On one hand it's a very warm, comfortable jacket, with decent workmanship.  But the sleeve length and foul odor make it a big dissapointment.  So unless you're built like a penguin I recommend buying local so you can try it on and make sure it does not stink.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 1 January 2015

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Overall I like this jacket, it is VERY warm. I wouldn't hesitate to wear this to shovel snow from my driveway, but it's not exactly a mountaineering jacket either. It will stop some wind and rain, but not much. This is the 3rd one I've bought, and the only reason I've replaced them is because I spend so much time outside that the black coat will turn an odd red/grey, so obviously not the most UV resistant dye. On my second coat, the left inside pocket stitching came apart, so I used some fabric glue to reattach it. On my newest one,  the arms are a little short on me, and the zipper sticks about 2/3 of the way down.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 21 October 2018

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: I just got this few days ago and tried it on yesterday for the first time (I ordered the long model after reading the other reviews)the size of the jacket is great, its slightly bigger (not taller) than expected, but thats not bad actually in case someone wears anything beneath it.however, the hood is comically over sized, in the photo I just simply pulled it over my head with simple motion with no adjustments what so ever, I can pretty much only see the ground couple of meters ahead of me.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 30 December 2015

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: My husband wears his midweight jacket underneath, so he can take this jacket off at work, and leave the other on. He works in a dealership garage so it’s not always the warmest. He likes the the way the wrist has the band inside the outer sleeve, so you don’t get a draft up the arm.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 11 February 2021

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Well made jacket . Hood resembles a monks cowl , hence the 4 stars . I was able to sew a 3 inch pleat across the shaping seams and tack it down where the hood meets the jacket . As with other Dickies jackets there is no hanging loop , something else I had to rectify . All in all though , my husband loves the jacket .
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 2 January 2017

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Nice over sleeves but a bit short over the front (large dude). Material, zipper, and weight is perfect. The hood is blizzard ready as it reaches over and hangs half way down the face line. For my size a 4XLT would fit better, but this one gets the job done with a few layers to take care of the belt line gap.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 24 September 2016

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: The coat is really warm and fits me perfectly. My only complaint is the hood seems entirely too large. It falls down over my eyes. Probably won't be so bad when I start wearing my wool hat. Until then, I probably won't use it unless I have to.I don't think you'll find a warmer or better quality coat for the price I paid ($49.99). I would recommend this coat to anyone.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 7 November 2013

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Jacket length is a little short
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 15 February 2021

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: 5'7" 330lbs fits absolutelyperfectly. I got the 3xl tall because I didn't want to run a risk of the jacket being too short. Perfect length and great fit overall. 5 out of 5.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 24 December 2020

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: I was planning on buying a Carhartt coat, as I buy from them a lot, but they didn't have a style in my size that I liked. So I took a chance with this coat, and man, it is awesome. It's warm. It's comfortable. It's got a ton of pockets (which I love). It is a little baggy or puffy, so when I had to wear a backpack or harness with it, it took a little adjusting, but overall, this coat is incredible.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 29 March 2014

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: I got the 2XLT green version of this dickies big tall sherpa lined hooded eisenhower jacket and its pretty much perfect. I modified it cutting the elastic out of the inner sleeve cuff and that made me a lot happier. Its a little heavier than it is warm, but thats prefect for texas. I sort need to breathe it out in the middle of the day.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 21 March 2017

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: This jacket is very well made. It is heavy, durable and very warm. I live in central Ontario and we are no stranger to -13F winter temps. The sherpa lining (chest, back and hood) is very insulating and comfortable. The sleeves are heavily quilted and also very warm. I like the dual layered cuffs, keeps wind and wet out and the covers my leather gloves perfectly. Hood is a little on the large size, but manageable. I would definitely buy another of these jackets, but I have a feeling it's going to last awhile!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 26 December 2013

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: I bought this for my 18 year old Stepson an he LOVES it...The sizing was true too form and the jacket is of the high quality we know DIckies brand for...It arrived yesterday, just in time for my Stepson to wear it while Christmas caroling outside with his Madrigal Choir group...We live in Minnesota and the temperature was frigid...He came home all smiles telling us how warm and toasty the jacket kept him....It was a great night seeing his smile of delight...THANKS DIckies!!!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 15 December 2013

ProductName: Dickies Men's Big-Tall Sanded Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket
Review: Great jacket. The fit is as expected. I am 6'5" 300 lbs and the jacket is a good fit except for the hood. I can fit it over my motor cycle helmet. I am not sure why it is so large but that does not take away from this being a great jacket for an extra tall 3 extra large guy. Thanks dickies for nice work clothing.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 17 December 2016

ProductName: PERFEHAIR Barber Jacket for Men, Hair Stylist Grooming Smock Vest Shirt, Vintage Print
