ProductName: Wrangler Men's Regular Blanket Lined Denim Jacket
Review: The purchase of this jacket was one of my best-researched, but still worrying purchases. As it's not available from Wrangler AU I had to order in from Wrangler US. There are many lined denim or corduroy jackets about, but sizing varies considerably amongst the various brands. I currently own no Wrangler jackets to compare the new one with, and having two choices in XL (46 & 48) was slightly confusing, but welcome. My main worry was whether I needed 46 (slightly larger than my nominal chest size) or 48 to allow for layering. I ordered 46 and it was an extremely anxious (and rather long) wait for it to arrive. It fits well, the 48 would have been too big. Having recently bought an unlined jacket in XXL from a different company, which was too small for anything but summer shirts underneath, I was very relieved.I noted comments in reviews about the buttons and concur with those complaints- the button holes are indeed poorly executed  and very tight when new. One of the sizing issues I had was whether my arms would feel constricted with the lining. Many lined jackets do not extend the lining to the arms. Even with winter clothes on I could get my arms in fine with this jacket, and allowance in sizing appears to have been made for the blanket lining. I noted comments about plain grey blanket lining but mine is the red/grey mix as per product photos.The price was reasonable and compared favourably with Wrangler jackets available in Australia. Indeed, Amazon's price was a little better than Wrangler's own when USD was converted to AUD, with free shipping. My only minor complaint with this jacket would be that it looks a little too "western" for this urban cowboy, but it is after all a Wrangler.The jacket looks great with the corduroy collar, preferable to either plain denim or fake sheepskin, and the blanket lining is more attractive than other Wrangler jackets which have bright red plaid flannel or the aforementioned "Sherpa", or fake sheepskin. Overall I'm very pleased with this jacket, and can add to my collection of countries of manufacture for later "US" goods, for this jacket was made in Nicaragua. It certainly beats "Made in China".
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Australia on 21 June 2021

ProductName: Wrangler Men's Regular Blanket Lined Denim Jacket
Review: Está hecha con mezclilla, forro y botones de excelente calidad.No destiñe al lavar y secar en máquina.Es muy caliente porque tiene un forro de paño de lana, no aborregado.Luce bastante bien y es la clásica chamarra vaquera de estilo muy varonil.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Mexico on 16 May 2023

ProductName: Wrangler Men's Regular Blanket Lined Denim Jacket
Review: after reading reviews i got a size larger than i normally wear. it fits pretty loose in the body but the arms are just right. good solid work/casual coat. i recommend it to anyone
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 7 January 2015

ProductName: Wrangler Men's Regular Blanket Lined Denim Jacket
Review: Great quality. Best price I've ever seen. Looks and feels great. Fully lined as expected but its light weight and warm. My teen daughters gave me the thumbs up!  I do recommend it.However, I ordered size 44 based on the size chart. I should have guessed that I would receive a 44L from a Tall and Big listing.  I thought about returning it but it fits well in the body and feels quite comfortable on. It actually works out better because the Long extends below the belt and below the wrists which keeps out the cold.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 22 January 2015

ProductName: Wrangler Men's Regular Blanket Lined Denim Jacket
Review: Regular delivery option was fast.  Excellent quality of materials and workmanship. Looks great and warm enough for Canadian winters.  In my opinion only improvement would be one or two inside large pockets.  I'm a short stocky guy, about 5 ft 3in and 160lbs, jacket fits very good but with most jackets I just need to fold in the sleeves a little for an excellent fit.  This jacket is hard to find in stores but when available it is usually at least 50% more in price.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on 3 February 2020

ProductName: Wrangler Men's Regular Blanket Lined Denim Jacket
Review: Arrived as described.  I am 6'3", 250 lbs, medium build.  Initial fit is very good.  The jacket arms cuff reaches past my wrist to mid thumb area. The jackets length is long enough and is about 5" below my belt line (mid hip)  There is sufficient room when buttoned making wearing of a hoody underneath comfortable without being restricted or too tight.Happy with my purchase.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on 15 February 2021

ProductName: Wrangler Men's Regular Blanket Lined Denim Jacket
Review: I had no issues with buttons or anything as some other reviews stated. True to size. The quality is excellent, and it is incredibly warm!  I could not be happier,and it looks great!

ProductName: Wrangler Men's Regular Blanket Lined Denim Jacket
Review: I’m 5’10 and bought a 40. It fits exactly right. I weigh 165lbs. I could’ve even sized up to a 42. The jacket fits true to size and the sleeves and body are shorter than usual. Similar to a Levi jacket than my other flannel lined wrangler in a medium which fits larger than this. The jacket is decent quality besides the entire lining and sleeves being synthetic. The cotton shell is good. I dislike the button holes and hem because the stitching is loose all around and the button holes have lots of excess thread or aren’t cut open wide enough. So you have to burn off the excess and cut some holes a bit wider. Overall it’s alright. But it should be higher quality for the price. The flannel lined wrangler has none of these defects and is cheaper but not as warm. This collar is nice too and once it’s broken in I’m sure it’ll be great. Wrangler in 2020. Still alright. If you can find a lightly used vintage I suggest that route instead.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on 17 December 2020

ProductName: Wrangler Men's Regular Blanket Lined Denim Jacket
Review: This jacket fit perfectly. I am 6' 7" tall 190 lbs and have a terrible time finding clothes that fit. Big and Tall shops don't fit tall skinny guys, but this Wrangler product fit perfectly. Well done Wrangler.

Still a quality jacket that is warmer than I thought it would be now that I live in North Dakota. Anyway, its a good jacket.

Review: Love this jacket. ProductName: Wrangler Men's Regular Blanket Lined Denim Jacket
Review: Jacket fits great. The sleeves are perfect,not too long, not too short. The chest is a little loose but acceptable. Nice heavy denim. This Jacket has the true blanket lining. Wrangler sells another jacket with a "blanket lining" that to me is just thin flannel. The only thing I really don't care for is the collar, which is a tan corduroy type material. I would have preferred just regular blue denim. People have complained that the buttons are too stiff and they had to snip the threads in the button holes. The buttons are stiff,  but after using for a week they are starting to loosen on their own. The jacket is warm for 30+degree temperatures. Anything colder may need a heavier coat. All in all I believe this jacket is well worth the price
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 19 January 2021

ProductName: Wrangler Men's Regular Blanket Lined Denim Jacket

Nothing cozy about the fabric at all. Returned.

Overall I'm very pleased and much warmer in my open topped jeep in the cold early mornings.  Mine says made in Nicaragua.

ProductName: Wrangler Men's Regular Blanket Lined Denim Jacket
Review: I’ve always wanted a blue Jean jacket and I had to wait till I was 66 to get one. This is one well-made wrangler blue Jean jacket. I am very pleased. If I could give it 10 stars I would I would tell anybody that is looking for one to buy this one because it’s gonna be gone soon since wrangler discontinued it which I can’t understand well-built, and worth what I paid for

ProductName: Wrangler Men's Regular Blanket Lined Denim Jacket
Review: Had to replace my husbands old denim jacket that he had for so many years.  This is a different brand than then the other one, but looks like it.  This jacket is made very well except for the fact that when we went to unbutton to try it on we had a very had time getting the buttons undone.  Once we did I had to clip some of the threads to make it easier for next time.  On the top pockets you can see a faint line right aross, but only notice if you are looking for it.  Does not really take away from the jacket.  Husband is very pleased and we would definitely purchase another one in the future.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 18 November 2020

ProductName: Wrangler Men's Regular Blanket Lined Denim Jacket
Review: I like the quality of the jacket. Well made, the lining is warm. The button closure is reinforced with multiple stitch passing. Great cowboy jacket from Wrangler and the look is spot on. Get one if you can.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 15 January 2023

ProductName: Wrangler Men's Regular Blanket Lined Denim Jacket
Review: This is a great denim jacket.  I’ve loved my unlined Wrangler Denim Jacket for the past twenty five years, and still wear it.  But I decided I wanted to have a warmer version for cold nights or days.  I ordered this jacket and I was really happy with the blanket lining.  It’s a nice thick lining.  It’s not too bulky, but really adds warmth.  The weight of the denim jacket is nice and thick and cuts the wind pretty well.  On top of that, Wrangler denim fades really nicely over time, only getting better with age.  I really like this jacket a lot.  The lighter colored corduroy color is okay.  I would have preferred the classic blue denim collar, but the light corduroy looks a little sharper for wearing out to dinner, if that makes a difference to you.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 18 January 2020

ProductName: Men's Arctic Quilted Lined Duck Vest Washed Full Zip Up Utility Rugged Canvas Work Vest Jacket
Review: Je recommande seule petit truc la fermeture éclaire reste coincée parfois.

Review: Looks like other brands at a better price

ProductName: Men's Arctic Quilted Lined Duck Vest Washed Full Zip Up Utility Rugged Canvas Work Vest Jacket
Review: The softest, warmest, vest on the inside, and very tough on the outside. Exactly what I needed for my handyman work and cold walks, paired with other warm thermal layers. Worth every second of the wait for a restock, and blows other more expensive brand names out lf the water. slim 5’7 145lb wearing a small.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 6 December 2023

ProductName: Men's Arctic Quilted Lined Duck Vest Washed Full Zip Up Utility Rugged Canvas Work Vest Jacket
Review: Husband loves it,fits great.Very warm.Husband loves it fits great very warm.Would recommend
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 30 November 2023

ProductName: Men's Arctic Quilted Lined Duck Vest Washed Full Zip Up Utility Rugged Canvas Work Vest Jacket
Review: I purchased it for my boyfriend to replace a well broken in carhartt vest. Right away you can tell it’s great quality. I was worried at first it might have been too large, and even my boyfriend has said it was too big. Until you wash it. After that I had him try it on again without telling him I washed it and he said hey you made it fit. I also did put it up back to back to another vest he wears all the time and it aaa spot on same size. I’ve got a bad habit of shrinking things in the dryer from time to time, so I made sure I  did dry it on low, zipped up and inside out in an effort to keep the zipper straight and from ugly folds getting worked in from being rolled in the dryer, other wise I normally wouldn’t put it in the dryer.prolonged high heat can wear the elastic and metal out faster . A feature that is different than the big name brand is the collar, instead of a turn down type it’s more of an elastic ribbing. That can be nice if it you get to wearing a shirt with a collar or flannel,  there’s less bulk in the chin area, which I think enables more maneuverability without those items interfering doing some physical out door activities. The only thing it didn’t have that a big name brand did was another additional inner pocket and the outer zipper chest pocket. But I think that’s first world problems. My boyfriend is 5’11 and 200 pounds  wears large size size shirts and large size jackets and vests.i ordered what he wears. He’s been wearing it since he got it. It’s looks kinda fluffy until it’s broken in if you know what I mean.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 2 April 2022

ProductName: Men's Arctic Quilted Lined Duck Vest Washed Full Zip Up Utility Rugged Canvas Work Vest Jacket
Review: I wanted a vest that is warm and rugged. This meets both.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 15 April 2023

ProductName: Men's Arctic Quilted Lined Duck Vest Washed Full Zip Up Utility Rugged Canvas Work Vest Jacket
Review: I like this vest.  Very comfortable for working in climates like here on the Oregon Coast, not too cold.  I did a big fence project yesterday; up and down, rolling around in the dirt, laying on the ground.  The canvas material brushed right off without a stain.  It fits a tad bigger than I had hoped.  Maybe one washing will bring it down a tad;  the insulation is quite warm and feels nice, doesn't bind up.  Certainly good value for the price point.  The competitive industry standard leader is 3x this cost.  Good deal.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 4 February 2023

ProductName: Men's Arctic Quilted Lined Duck Vest Washed Full Zip Up Utility Rugged Canvas Work Vest Jacket
Review: can't go wrong on this one!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 28 January 2024

ProductName: Men's Arctic Quilted Lined Duck Vest Washed Full Zip Up Utility Rugged Canvas Work Vest Jacket
Review: I was looking for a work “duck cotton” type vest. Was looking for something that wasn’t as stiff and expensive as Carhartt, or to thin as a Walmart Wrangler(no hood vest-the hooded vest is actually a great compromise but didn’t want a hood).  This vest fit the bill. Feels thick but not stiff. Very comfortable. Seems to run a little big(as I tried on large vest in all the varieties I tried on) and this one felt bigger. So I ordered a size down, and now I’m really happy with the fit. I’m 5’9 190lbs. Highly recommend this vest for the price!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 10 October 2022

ProductName: Men's Arctic Quilted Lined Duck Vest Washed Full Zip Up Utility Rugged Canvas Work Vest Jacket

ProductName: Men's Arctic Quilted Lined Duck Vest Washed Full Zip Up Utility Rugged Canvas Work Vest Jacket
Review: We usually have mild winters in Puget Sound Region of Western Washington, but every so often it actually gets too cold for my usual fleece vest to keep me warm. When the temperature dropped into the low 20s last month, it was the perfect opportunity to see how effective this quilt-lined canvas duck vest would be for some hiking around town. My only concern was that it might be TOO warm...but the vest kept me comfortable without overheating.The canvas exterior is rugged and a bit stiff, though it should break in with more wear.  It fits me very well, especially around the shoulders and armholes. The ribbed collar is soft enough not to irritate my neck. I haven't worn the vest outside while it's drizzling or snowing, so I can't comment on how well it resists moisture.Only negative is that this vest makes me look even chunkier than I am, leading my Spousal Unit to claim I resemble a toasted Sta-Puft Marshmallow Man. Which made me crave marshmallows, and we all know that won't help.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 30 January 2020

ProductName: Men's Arctic Quilted Lined Duck Vest Washed Full Zip Up Utility Rugged Canvas Work Vest Jacket
Review: This is a big and comfortable vest. The canvas outer portion is tough as nails and will probably last a lifetime. There are two deep and roomy pockets too - deep enough for a smartphone (I keep my Kindle in one!) There are no snaps or fasteners, so they are open pockets though. There is an internal pocket too which a bit smaller than the outer ones, but still useful.  Curiously, the inner pocket has a button closure - just a bit odd in my estimation.The quilted fleece lining is plush and very warm. The vest is a great core insulator and useful both as a standalone cover on cool hikes, or a layered vest under a coat on very cold ones. I should note that although this is described as a men's vest, the zipper is on the left side.  I don't mind when zipping up, but when I unzip my right hand dominance kicks in.Otherwise, this vest is terrific.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 4 February 2020

ProductName: Men's Arctic Quilted Lined Duck Vest Washed Full Zip Up Utility Rugged Canvas Work Vest Jacket
Review: This vest fits my husband as expected. However, apparently a pretty big deal to him is the zipper which is on the "female side".He finds it really frustrating.The inside lining is very soft, and that lining is in the hand pockets also.The material feels very much like his Carhartt coats.This vest’s inside pocket has a button while Carhartt's vest like this doesn't have a button on the inside pocket.It's a pretty bulky vest compared to the other one he owns and therefore warmer, but more restrictive of his movements.He likes that the collar doesn't have a flap and is very comfortable.Overall, he would prefer the inside to be less soft and the zipper to start from the other side.**If you found this review helpful, please click the ‘Helpful’ button below.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 7 January 2020

ProductName: Men's Arctic Quilted Lined Duck Vest Washed Full Zip Up Utility Rugged Canvas Work Vest Jacket
Review: The vest is WAAAAY better than I expected!First, I did not realize the inside of the vest is VELVETY quilt-lined!  So are the huge pockets!The opening to the pockets is big, and the pocket itself is huge!  Plus, inside the vest, there is a big, securable hidden pocket!The neck is this cottony material that stretches but is very comfortable!  It is virtually the perfect size!I got the XXL and it has just enough room to be roomy, but it doesn't appear to be too big.  I like extra room rather than a tiny bit too tight.I compared this to big-name brands of which, I have two, and I actually like this one better!  My son has a bunch of these work vests and now he wants to still mine!  I must say, I really like this vest!  The stitching is VERY sturdy but unobtrusive.The fact that this vest is so comfortable, warm, and rugged is really value-added given the very reasonable price and the great looks!  If you had a business, and you needed to buy a bunch of vests and have them embroidered with your company logo while saving a bunch of money!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 20 December 2019

ProductName: Men's Arctic Quilted Lined Duck Vest Washed Full Zip Up Utility Rugged Canvas Work Vest Jacket
Review: This vest has a warm quilted lining and the outer material is a medium weight duck cloth. It is similar to a Carhartt vest but not as stiff probably due to the stonewashed material. It doesn't have a wind flap behind the zipper and the zipper pulls from the left side which may be a little awkward for some people. Overall it appears to be well made and should be a fine work vest.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 17 December 2019

ProductName: Men's Arctic Quilted Lined Duck Vest Washed Full Zip Up Utility Rugged Canvas Work Vest Jacket
Review: Man, this is a fantastic vest. Outer Material is 100% Cotton Canvas,12-ounce washed duck cloth- which is NOT water repellent, but it can be treated.  However it is very tough.The nylon lining  insulation is super warm and fuzzy, and even in the pockets, so your hands feel warm and fuzzy too!  The lining sets this vest aside- not just warm but comfortable too!Not necessarily a work  vest , good for daily use during the cooler times of year.Sadly, I wont get to wear it much, my wife appropriated it!Overall, this "ZENTHACE Men's Washed Arctic-Quilt Lined Duck Vest Utility Rugged Canvas Work Vest" was a big hit!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 23 January 2020

ProductName: Men's Arctic Quilted Lined Duck Vest Washed Full Zip Up Utility Rugged Canvas Work Vest Jacket
Review: My dad LOVES this vest.  It's so similar to Car <3 brand, you can barely tell the difference between the 2 when compared side by side.But, if you look at your wallet, you'll def be able to tell the difference being as that this vest costs almost less than half of what the brand name version does.We applied additional scotch-guard but because my dad wears it on a regular basis, it still needed to be washed after a month of use.  It washed up perfectly.  No fade, no shrinkage whatsoever.  We hung it on a hanger to dry, not in the dryer.Our entire family has always been big Carhartt fans, and continue to be, but this vest is a solid choice as well .I hope you like it as much as my dad does.  :)Thank you for reading.

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: Pedí este producto de manera anticipada, aún no empezaban las lluvias, apenas había llovido pocas veces por lo cual no había sido posible poner a prueba el producto. Sin embargo hoy, con una lluvia moderada pero constante, demostró su efectividad. En mi traslado a pie de mi casa a la oficina, aproximadamente 10 minutos. Llegué completamente SECO (al menos del torso, que es la parte que cubre) En realidad parece mágico, las gotas de agua resbalan, no penetran la fibra. El producto es 100% ligero, fácil de guardar/transportar. En cuestion a la talla, generalmente soy talla mediana, sin embargo estuve leyendo las opiniones de otros compradores y con base a ello pedí una talla mas chica, entonces pedí TALLA CHICA AUN SIENDO MEDIANO y para mi sorpresa (positiva) me queda a la perfección. Así que efectivamente pidan una talla mas chica de preferencia, por otro lado cabe mencionar que esta talla a pesar de ser mas chica de lo que normalmente acostumbro y de que me quedó bastante bien, estoy seguro de que me da todavía la oportunidad de usar alguna chamarra por debajo, en caso de ser necesario, aunque es importante mencionar, que la prenda no permite que salga el calor de tu propio cuerpo, por lo cual, a pesar de ser tan delgada, no sientes frío, pero no se debe meramente a que sea una prenda caliente, sino que se encierra tu propio calor, mientras que te lo pongas cuando aún estás seco, cumplirá su función a la perfección. Otros momentos en los que he tenido la oportunidad de probarlo han sido en carretera en moto y tambien se ha desempeñado de manera cabal.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Mexico on 19 June 2021

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: This is the windbreaker I grab when I'm heading to an outdoor event with a small possibility of some rain. It's lightweight, packs up reasonably well, and has a roomy fit. It's not plastic like a real raincoat, and I wouldn't expect it to keep me dry in a downpour; it's just a layer between you and the damp of a windy drizzle.I prefer this Men's fit because it's easy to pull on and off without yanking up all the clothes I have on underneath. I like the material, which is more like a normal fabric than your typical rain gear. The hood is roomy enough to hold all my hair, loose or in a ponytail. The one thing I don't like is the amount of “noise” this windbreaker makes: any movement, large or small, generates a loud swish-swish-swish sound! People definitely will hear you coming long before you arrive!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 2 October 2017

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: This windbreaker fits well.  I've worn it in light rain a couple of times and it has done a good job of keeping me dry.  It's light weight and easy to pack.  My only quibble is the label flap on the back of the neck.  For reason I understand, they didn't want to sew the label onto the inside of the back panel of the windbreaker.  It would have created an unsightly seam conforming to the label on the outside of the back panel.  This could also have been another seam that allows water infiltration.  However, their solution was to sew an extra fabric panel on the inside that shares the seam between the hood and the back panel.  Onto this they sewed all the labels.  It actually looks very nice.  However, when you pull this over your head, this flap, only secured on the top seam, often flips up outside of the neckline.  It's easily tucked back in.  But, it's a minor nuisance and something that could have easily been solved by printing the label onto the inside of the back panel fabric rather than using a separate label that requires sewing.  If not for this, I would give it five stars.  It's a very good product for the money, just not an excellent one due to a design decision.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 26 August 2014

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: i purchased this jacket because i love hoodies and with the warmer weather coming it will be to hot with a hoodie on. i absolutely love it. the material is lovey it is softish and i get many compliments on it and everyone asks where i bought it from. i have sent many of my friends your way to purchase them as well. i will be ordering in a different color soon.There is one thing for me, i have short arms and the arms are too long, but i just fold them under and that works just fine as the cuffs have and elasitc band inside.The rest fits just wonderful, lots of room if it was a chilly night and i wanted to wear a hoodie under it,

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: This anorak is great! I’m bit of a stocky short guy and I wanted a bit of a looser fit because this was gonna be something I threw on top of a button up shirt/crewneck sweater, so I got an XL and it fits great to be honest. It’s a lighter anorak, but I feel like it’s still thick enough to keep you warm if you wear enough inside. If you wear this during a summer rainy day over a tshirt it should be more than enough tbh.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on 2 January 2021

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: My family and I have purchased many of these in different colors. They’re lightweight, easy to wear and the pockets are so convenient.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 17 November 2023

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: Fit as expected.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on 10 December 2018

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: a good windbreaker for over heavy jacket; or for hot summer days or Santana winds of SoCal
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 1 March 2016

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: I wore this to a cool weather football game with a couple layers underneath. It fits according to the listed size and it was a good outer shell, retaining heat well...
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 20 November 2023

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: Very good product quality
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 May 2015

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: I’m 5’8 and 140lbs and the xs was perfect for me, a small would have been too big. The jacket is a bit long but has a drawstring at the side if you want to make it shorter. I’ve worn it in light rain and it repelled water just fine!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on 29 July 2021

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: If the jacket was properly sized it would have been exactly what I wanted. The medium size was bigger than a medium but not quite as big as a large otherwise the make and style were perfect.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on 20 June 2022

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: I wear an XL in most jackets, sweaters, pullovers. Based on reviews I went down a size to large and it fits perfectly. I highly recommend you do the same. I am very happy with the purchase. Received it prompty and it is of high quality and just overall right product, price , quality
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 31 December 2014

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: So perfect I bought 2 more in different colors. You can't beat it for the price. If I might offer one suggestion (if the manufacturer is listening...) - make the same thing, but without a hood. I'll buy it!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 18 October 2017

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: too big
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 May 2016

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: One of my favourite pieces of outer wear.Light but protective.Lots of room to layer underneath.Great price.INCLUSIVE SIZING - huge thank you.

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: Más amplio de lo normal

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: Exactly as expected.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 5 September 2014

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: Great lightweight material, nice when you want an extra layer over a short sleeve shirt. I wanted the pullover because I don't like how a lightweight zip up jacket flaps in the wind when its zipped down. Bear in mind that this isnt completely waterproof, if you're in the rain for awhile or its raining very hard, you will start to feel moisture on your bare arms. I love the color and the zip up kangaroo pocket is nice to throw things in. I would definitely purchase it again.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on 21 July 2019

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: like the front zip pocket but I did get a small rip in the fabric from walking/hiking around big rock cliffs/boulders. Not breathable!  Great space saver and light for packing in a hiking pack!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on 19 September 2023

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: Good.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 December 2015

ProductName: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
Review: Nice jacket , great quality , used as an emergency jacket kept in my Back pack for inclement days .Used for a few rainy and quite windy days , with no complaints ,Soft and supple material , very comfortable .
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on 16 October 2021

Reviewer: Ordered a medium and true to size. Excellent …
Review: Ordered a medium , 5’11 12st, very good fit…

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Forgot Foo Foo puffer vests, this is The One. The quality is true Carhartt, the fit is comfortable AND sleek and fitted, warm yet breathable. Side snap pockets, front chest zipper and internal zip pockets. This is my new favorite by far.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 9 May 2023

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: C'est le second gilet. Renouveler un achat est synonyme de satisfaction.

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: La talla es realmente es la que indica el producto, no viene ni reducida ni amplia

Review: Amo esta marca calidad y durabilidad

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: A cumplido todas mis expectativas .

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Great quality and fit! My husband has a few of them!

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Es muy corto el chaleco, ademas de que la calidad parece de inditex, compren mejor un columbia, el precio es similar y la calidad es muuuuy superior
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Mexico on 16 March 2022

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Ordered 2 of these for grandsons. They wore them immediately. Better price than ordering from their website.  Nice fabric, quality.  Wouldn’t hesitate to purchase them again(if need be).
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 26 January 2024

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: I have pieces of carhartt clothing already so I was aware but the vest does run big of what I would consider traditional sizes. I wear a large T-shirt but ordered a medium vest and it fits great and looks good!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 2 January 2024

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: My husband is usually a large. I got him a large tall and it was still snug when zipped up. I recommend sizing up for a more comfortable fit.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 10 January 2024

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Like many contractors, I've been wearing Carhartt for years.  These vests are light and warm.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 6 October 2023

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Perfect for fall. Fit and workmanship is great.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 2 September 2023

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: I read a prior review that sizing ran large. I normally would buy a large, but because of that review I first bought a medium. It was too tight in the abdomen and waist. I returned it and replaced it with a large, and it was perfect. So I recommend just buying your normal size. I bought it in black, like it so much I ordered another in blue.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 14 January 2023

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Reviewer: M I C H E L
Review: Gilet non troppo pesante, l’ho comprato per lavorare, non amo vestire troppo pesante, il gilet con sotto una felpa ti fa stai caldo e ti muovi agilmente. Il materiale sembra resistente, sono 173cm x 95 kg e la taglia L va bene, la taglia M mi stava stretta di spalle e di pancia.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Italy on 6 April 2023

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: I was wanting something that wasn’t  bulky and comber some, which this jacket is neither.  It’s dressy enough for just about anything and perfect with just a pair of jeans and a nice shirt.  Warm enough to work in cooler temperatures, but not in super cold, 30 and below...but what is?  The extra inside pockets are perfect.  At first I didn’t think I would like the reverse flap front “Hand” pockets, but they are actually very good and come with a single snap. Things don’t fall out of the front pockets like money and keys when you sit down and if you were concerned about someone pick pocketing you, they would definitely have a more difficult time.  Great vest and I would definitely buy it again.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 12 February 2021

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Love this vest good quality. I should have got L tall, but thats my fault. Anyone else 6 foot 1 185lbs make sure you get xl or L tall.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on 20 November 2022

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Poor build quality and customer service policy.  I just got this vest and after the first wash (per the tags washing instructions) a seem is torn.  I called Carhart customer service.  They are having me send mine back so they can inspect it and determine if it is a defect or not.  If they determine it is a defect, then they will send me a new one.  This whole process is expected to take 2-3 weeks.  This really surprises me for Carhart and the price paid for the product.  I would have expected that they would send me a new one, then I send mine back.  Not happy that I will be without this for a few weeks.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 29 December 2023

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: I wore this throughout the fall and spring, and even during the winter under a waterproof shell a few times. I have zero complaints. It fits well and keeps me warm enough without making me sweat. It's nice enough that it doesn't look out of place worn over a button up shirt, but it's tough enough to split wood on the weekends without me worrying about destroying it either. Great vest!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 6 June 2022

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Great all around vest, I take it everywhere. My wife liked it so much I bought her one.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 27 December 2022

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: I’m a carhart guy and have everything from socks to hats. I really went back and forth on this. Was not sure I needed something for those times a jacket is too much etc.  Got this today and am really happy I took the leap. High 40s today and perfect for outdoor work. A little pricey, but you get what you pay for. Feels good and looks good. A great addition by itself or as an extra layer.I’m 5’10, 180lbs and got a large. Fits perfect.@@Update- 1-22-19 I’m at Hatteras Island at the Outer Banks doing some “work”. Cold and windy. Wore this “working” outside with 37 degree temps and windy. Great wind breaker and the parts the vest covered felt good. Happy with my purchase.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 16 January 2019

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: The vest fits perfect and it is of a great quality
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 15 December 2022

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Breaks my heart to give 3 stars and not 5. It was tough to find a vest of this type that doesn’t bull on neck hairs if you don’t shave everyday, but this one does the trick. Now, for why it’s 3 stars. The Major draw back is the stitching. I’ve worn this maybe for a few months now, generally late at night as an extra layer when walking my dog. With literally NO labor performed wearing the vest, not even snow removal from a car, and stitching throughout has begun to pull. I haven’t washed it yet either, so I’m not really sure what can contribute to this. Sad as otherwise it is a perfect vest, but within a year I’d imagine it’ll be frayed all over, which seems fast for the price.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 4 March 2021

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: worth it
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on 17 July 2022

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Carhartt is so hard to judge on size especially for men. This vest size fits as specified size. The length comes down a little past where belt would sit on waist and is bit baggy hair heavy like some of the other vests. This vest is great quality and will definitely keep you warm it light enough to wear in mid range weather. Would definitely bug again.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 13 February 2021

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: This is one of my favorite vests but I always leave my Carhartt shirts untucked but I just wish the length was longer.  It is longer in the back but the front is really short.  I still wear it and just live with it but this would have been a five star if they offered a big and tall longer option.  Most of my other vests are longer in the front like I like but definitely worth getting.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 20 January 2019

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: My brother-in-law had bought this before Christmas and when I saw it, I had to have it!  It has pockets in all the perfect places: left breast side (outer and inner!) and two on each side.  I'm always in-between a men's L and XL and the same holds true here. The Large fits as I would expect, not a lot of extra room, but I can zip it and feel good wearing it.It's very lightweight so not for a ski day or a sub zero day but perfect accent or layer. Feels great!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 5 January 2019

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Me quedo como yo esperaba
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 24 November 2022

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: I bought it to replace my XL Patagonia, which inevitably wore out.  I tried a Carhartt XL, but it was too big.  The L is just right.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 26 February 2022

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: So I ruined this same vest in Medium (5'8" 165) and athetic build.  The older vest fit perfectly, the new cut is much tighter all the way across and I'm still the same size/shape.  Just be careful as you may need to order 'up'
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 19 October 2020

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: It's a good product.  I like the amount of pockets.  The thermal aspect of it could be a little better, as well as the length.  I'm 5'11" and 170 lbs.  I ordered a medium, which makes it nice for using as an under layer, but as an outer layer, I have to tuck in my shirts or else they will hang out the bottom.  Could of gone for a large, but I like layering and don't want to be baggy.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 1 January 2018

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: If you're in construction and wear Carhartt, chances are you're probably not out in the field much anymore... This vest is great to protect me from the harsh Air Conditioning of our amazing HVAC system
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 29 November 2021

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Great vest it's light yet warm and isn't too poofy like a down vest would be. I am 5'10 medium upper 32x32 pant size and it fits me perfect.Only thing I didn't like about the vest is the design of the pockets they are backwards as in the flaps open forward. Not a huge deal but kind of annoying.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 27 March 2020

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: I ordered a regular large and was sent a large big and tall. I returned it and ordered a regular medium and was sent a medium lose fit. It was not drastically different than a regular medium and probably ended up being better as it was a gift for someone else. None the less the wrong size was sent two times.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 11 January 2022

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Just what I was expecting. Smooth material that doesn't scratch the back of my neck, and very comfortable in cool weather.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 19 February 2022

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Surprisingly warm for its light weight.

Review: Fits perfectly. Works perfect for chili days without a full jacket.

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Nothing.

Review: This was the fourth vest I tried, as the others lacked either fit or warmth. This proved to be a very good combinaion of comfortable fit and warmth for its weight. Very pleased with the product.

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Great vest. Fits under a jacket and a good base layer .

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Fit was as expected,  very well made product, great quality as expected from Carhartt...

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Great vest to wear over a long sleeve or even a sweater. It’s not puffy at all like some of the old vests from a while back. It also isn’t very warm when temperatures get down to 45deg. But it’s perfect for my everyday use. And looks great
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 28 December 2019

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Ordered the medium even though I usually wear a large and it fit well.  A large would have been just a bit loose which would have been ok too.  Lightweight and warm.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 29 December 2020

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Fit was as expected, much better than the canvas vest.

ProductName: CARHARTT Men's Gilliam Vest
Review: Goes with anything. Lightweight and warm.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 18 January 2022

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: The Columbia vest - as well as the Mountain Full Zip - are very nice and comfortable products - which most of the reviews agree with - However, I'm writing this review to talk about sizing - as few reviews actually deal with this very important aspect of any online purchase.  So I wish more people would post their height and weight and what size worked well for them.  With the vest and the Mountain Full Zip I actually ended up purchasing a medium in both styles - even though I normally wear a large in just about everything else.  For the record, I'm six feet tall and weigh 182 pounds - and the mediums fit perfectly.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 30 November 2014

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Nice vest for my boyfriend, he asked for it for Christmas and he already had one in black so that shows how much he likes it. He has a small build but is not too skinny, he wears a Medium in button up shirts (from J Crew), but got a Small in this. So if you are in between sizes, I would say go to the smaller size.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 31 December 2013

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Very nice vest! I am 6'1", and 219 pounds. I almost always wear XL shirts, but based on other reviews I ordered this vest in large.  Fits perfectly, and unlike other vests I own, it has a bit of contour so it doesn't look baggy, plus the collar folds down neatly, which I much prefer over the stand-up type. The fleece is mid-weight, smooth textured, and attractive.  I recommend these.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 9 May 2016

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Great vest!  I love Columbia products!  Well made...look 'classy'.  This was a great value too!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 17 November 2015

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Very soft, comfortable, and warm
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 23 December 2015

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Hi All.  You can not go wrong with this "Fleece Vest", for the price.  It is very soft, and is very warm.  And it does what it claims to do.  I will be buying some more of these.  As most of the time I hate to wear Bulky Jackets or very Heavy Winter Shirts.  I only need to keep my chest warmer on cold days.  For the price, this item is very well made.  It has nice Deep Inside Pockets, and nice Deep Side Pockets also, and the Zippers are really good also.  From  Dan & Austin, (My Yorkie)  We are Full-Timers, and True "Spirits of the Wind"
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 21 March 2015

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Great quality fleece, color, zipper and stiching. Thanks my son loves it.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 5 August 2014

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Was disappointed with the color. The color is nothing like the brown shown in the picture. It is more of a very dark charcoal gray
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 28 November 2015

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Wasn't really a fan of the material and it fit way too large even though a small. That being said, to every person their own still--I just love Columbia and was expecting so much more. I still love my other jacket by them, but this one sadly had to be returned.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 29 September 2016

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Very nice vest!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 13 January 2015

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Nothing to dislike.  It's just as described.  I've worn it with a sport jacket and I've worn it cross country skiing.  Nice and warm.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 6 March 2021

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: I love this vest. It is great to wear on cool evenings. I just wish that the vest was a bit larger in the chest area. It fits a bit too snug for large chested men.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 5 October 2014

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Very comfortable and warm! With the weather changing nothing keeps you warmer than a Columbia product! The fleece vest are my favorite.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 16 October 2014

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: If you are hoping for more Red the Orange DO NOT BUY.  This is closer to Orange than it is Red.  In other words think Fall Orange colors, pumpkins and Halloween.  Don't think Summer Red colors, fire engines and Christmas.  It is a nice vest, that is a burnt deep Orange.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 10 December 2016

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: This fits well for my medium size, and is quite comfortable
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 14 August 2014

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: I have had a Columbia fleece vest for over ten years. I wear it all the time in the cooler months. Wanted a red one,so I decided to give this one a try. Quality still excellent and the color is a deep red with a good fit.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 9 December 2014

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Light weight, warm, and fits well
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 24 January 2016

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Very nice fleece vest.  Love the color
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 20 February 2016

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: like vest...runs a little small to size of other like vests by Columbia
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 19 November 2014

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Will do just fine.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 17 October 2017

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: I bought this Columbia vest and  Stormtech Men's Chinook Fleece Vest at the same time.  Although the Columbia was $2.03 more expensive, the Stormtech is a far superior vest.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 7 February 2014

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: great quality,best price,warm good at work, over all great product for price.use in spring and winter,not so bulky easy to weare
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 13 December 2013

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: This vest is as soft as a baby blanket and as light as a feather. It is more of what I would call a "slim fit", which surprised me actually. Although, I was hoping for exactly that. I have always had trouble in the past ordering things that are supposed to be fitted yet turn out to be bloated. This was not the case with the Cathedral Peak II Vest. For the price point, I would say that you cannot afford to pass this up. The only downside is, it is made in China.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 6 October 2013

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: I am a big fan of vests in the winter--wear them daily.  I have only used LL Bean and Lands End in the past for vest needs.  I could not pass up the great price for this vest, though, and I was certainly not disappointed!  It's a great vest, though somewhat thinner and lighter than the other brands.  It is snugger in fit and the fleece has a nice nap to it.  I am well pleased with this vest.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 16 December 2013

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Little larger fit than expected, but hey.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 30 July 2016

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: I am 6'0" 170 lbs, I usually wear a medium but decided to get a small after reading other reviews suggesting to order one size smaller than usual. The length and fit are both fine, the vest looks and feels quite nice. Not a heavy duty vest, but will work just fine in somewhat cool temperatures when layered. Good vest overall, I am pleased with my purchase.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 15 October 2014

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: I got this with a gift card (thanks!); I like sleeves when cold, but wanted to try a vest. It's great! Light, comfortable and much warmer than I expected. Fit is good, true to size. The hand warmer pockets zip up from the bottom so things won't fall out and they're sewn in on 3 sides so also work as inside pockets.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 24 January 2014

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: My husband likes it. warm and comfortable.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 17 December 2014

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Such a nice and warm vest, perfect for Canadian weather! Material is high quality and very good price. It's just a bit long for me.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 2 October 2013

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Bought this for wear as an extra layer under my dress jacket. Looks very nice it is thin but very warm. I bought a medium so I could have a snug fit. I am 5' 7" or so and 150 lbs. Fits perfect and comes down to just below my belt. Still ample room for two shirts underneath as well. The two inside pockets are huge and would easily hold a 7" tablet for example, if need be. If your looking for a nice vest for any occasion then this is the one.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 10 December 2014

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Great color, just perfect medium weight vest.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 30 December 2015

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Very comfortable. Adds warmth without being too bulky.  Great for those cooler days with just a long sleeve shirt.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 10 May 2016

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: Bought this as a gift for my son. He does not like wearing a big coat. This vest adds warmth without too much bulk. He wears it indoors and outside.  The color is a nice red, not too bright. It was a great purchase for the price!

ProductName: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak
Review: I bought this vest as a "spare" to keep at the office. Here in Southern California, spring and autumn days can feel deceptively warm, only to cool down quickly to 60 F or below after dark. I have a habit of forgetting to bring any outerwear with me to the office, except in winter, and then wishing I had something light to wear for warmth if going straight from the office to a meeting or dinner or other social engagement. In this climate, a fleece vest passes for "outerwear" for all but the three coldest months. I have an older Element Red vest from Columbia, received as a gift many years ago, which has stood the test of time, so I thought I'd order Columbia again.Cost is reasonable for quality and priced perhaps 20-25% less than the famous outfitter from Freeport, Maine charges for its equivalent product. Fabric is soft and comfortable, not scratchy. Detailing is nice with two zip pockets, a collar that may be worn flat or straight up, and a hanger loop---a feature that my old Columbia vest lacks. Fit tends to be a half size larger than usual, so that my Large feels halfway between L and XL. If you want a trim fit, consider one size smaller than you usually order. On the other hand, if you want to layer it over a thermal top or sweater, buy your usual size and you'll appreciate the fuller than usual cut. Another plus is that it's offered in a dozen different colors, which again presents more choices than the competitor from Freeport.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 22 August 2014

ProductName: The North Face Men's M Resolve 2 Jacket
Review: Good fit, as expected.  Color is "Fiery Red" and it is a pretty vivid red, good for visibility in the dark, is true to that shown in the color options.  Cuffs are decently elasticized to limit wind and water entry.  Only two pockets, external and zippered, sufficiently sized.  I wish there had been an internal pocket.  Jacket features a main zipper all the way up to the full collar with four long, intermittent strips of hook and loop on the flap to limit water and wind reaching the zipper.  The collar has a thin felt layer for comfort against the neck and chin.  The non-removable hood is plenty deep, yet not overly so and does not obstruct level vision, and folds to store in the collar.  The jacket has an interior mesh lining to assist ventilation.  The hood and and waistline have drawstrings for sizing and limiting wind and rain entry.  The North Face logo is of the same color as the jacket, so is not very noticeable.  Some people might prefer it to be of a contrasting color, but that might require a different material that might create opportunities for water leakage.  The seams are tape-sealed.  Overall workmanship appears to be good.  I had purchased two other name-brand rain jackets but returned them for issues like excessive hood depth, excessive cuff openings and "sticky" urethane feel.  Although they had features that were attractive, overall they were not as satisfactory as this The North Face rain jacket.I've only tested this in light rain, so after a good, hard rain I'll hopefully enter a very positive rating on that final aspect.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Australia on 1 March 2020

ProductName: The North Face Men's M Resolve 2 Jacket
Review: it's a good color green. that's hard to determine on the internet.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Australia on 11 October 2020

Well made, could use some internal pockets for cell phone etc..

ProductName: Event Leather EL5315 Black Motorcycle Leather Vest for Men w/Side Lace- Riding Club Adult Motorcycle Vests - 5X-Large
Review: Great leather vest for the price. 4 pockets (2 outside and to big ones inside). Not strong smells as other reviews on different vests than this one. As in most vests, order one size up, even though the LEATHER laces will help to tighten the vest. I wear a size 44 jacket and I would normally would wear a L vest, but I ordered an XL and it fits perfect. Arrived promptly with 2 day Prime shipping in a large, flat box without being folded, great for a leather garment. The leather itself is not as soft as napa leather, but more to a stiffer texture, not too thick, not too thin, which I don't think is a problem on a biker's vest. I was also able to sew 4 patches with a household needle and black thread slowly, but without any issues, even though it was difficult being leather.  It also comes with a black satin liner and bronze snap buttons. Overall, very satisfied with this purchase, especially at $29.99.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 5 June 2017

ProductName: Event Leather EL5315 Black Motorcycle Leather Vest for Men w/Side Lace- Riding Club Adult Motorcycle Vests - 5X-Large
Review: Pleasantly Surprised.  I purchased this mainly to put together a Machete costume, so I didn't want to spend much money.  For $30.00 with Prime shipping, it was perfect.  I ordered a Large and it's true to size.  The leather quality seems good, it's not motorcycle jacket thick,  but thick and heavy enough that you won't think it'll fall apart on you.  The laces on the side are leather straps.  It has a satiny black lining and 2 large interior pockets.  Looking at it, I would think it worth at least twice what I paid for it.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 4 September 2014

ProductName: Event Leather EL5315 Black Motorcycle Leather Vest for Men w/Side Lace- Riding Club Adult Motorcycle Vests - 5X-Large
Review: I have to admit that I was not quite sure as to which size to opt for when I made the purchase. But, fortunately, it fits me perfectly. Not only that, but, it arrived a few days early too. Fits great, looks even better. Its safe to say that I will be purchasing more items from this seller.

ProductName: Stockerpoint Ricardo Men's Costume Vest
Review: My German husband often wears trachten (German/Austrian traditional clothing), but was looking for something extra to wear over his shirt in winter.Anyone who's ever bought trachten will know that it can be hugely expensive.  So this was a bit of a speculative purchase to see whether he'd enjoy wearing a traditional waistcoat.It has been a great success, in that it fits well, is comfortable and looks good.  The only criticism that I would possibly offer is that the 'velvet' material is not of a particularly high quality, but then that's to be expected for the very affordable price.Now that I've had a good experience of this brand, I'd probably choose to make future purchases from their higher priced range, knowing that it would be worn often (and thus justifying a greater cost).This would also be ideal for someone looking to buy this as a novelty item for an event such as Oktoberfest.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 January 2020

ProductName: Stockerpoint Ricardo Men's Costume Vest
Review: Die Samtweste Ricardo von Stockerpoint hat eine gute, wenn auch geradlinig breit geschnittene Passform, jedoch lässt sie sich mit dem Einstellriegel hinten leicht taillieren.Insgesamt wirkt sie hochwertig, ist natürlich dem Preis entsprechend nicht ganz so hochwertig verarbeitet wie deutlich hochpreisigere Samtwesten anderer Hersteller.Für das Fest im kleineren Kreis oder um die Tracht allgemein etwas aufzuwerten ist sie allemal gut, zumal nicht so viel kaputt geht wenn sie dann doch mal verfleckt.Für Hochzeiten (als Bräutigamm), Staatsempfänge o.ä. würde ich sie nicht empfehlen. Da rentiert sich meiner Meinung nach die Investition in ein teureres Modell von diversen namhaften Trachtmodenherstellern.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Germany on 26 July 2023

ProductName: Stockerpoint Ricardo Men's Costume Vest
Review: Ich hab mich für die „Stockerpoint Herren Weste Ricardo Trachtenweste“ entschieden, da ich für das nächste Frühlingsfest und Oktoberfest  (nach Corona :)) eine neue Samtweste brauchte.Positiv:  + schöne satte dunkelrote Farbe (siehe Fotos)  + Knopfleiste mit matten Metall Kugelknöpfe – so wie ich's mir vorgestellt habe  + passt mir perfekt – sonst habe ich ebenfalls Größe 50 bzw. Größe M  + sehr gute Verarbeitung  + 100% Baumwolle. Das Innenfutter ist aber aus 100% Polyester (siehe Foto)Neutral:  o  lässt sich natürlich nicht in der Waschmaschine waschen – was ich mir eigentlich auch dachte. Auf der  Beschreibung ist aber „Pflegehinweis: Maschinenwäsche“ angegeben. Hier muss der Verkäufer aus meiner  Sicht nachbessern!  o die Taschenschlitze sind nur zur Optik und können nicht als Tasche genutzt werden. Mir war das bewusst,  da es bei meiner jetzigen Trachtenweste genauso ist – sollte man aber beim Kauf wissen :)Die dunkelrote/ bordeauxrote Samtweste lässt sich sehr gut mit einem weißen Hemd mit Stehkragen kombinieren. Ich bin hoch zufrieden und kann die „Stockerpoint Herren Weste Ricardo Trachtenweste“ weiterempfehlen.Ich hoffe, dass ich euch bei der Entscheidungsfindung etwas helfen konnte :)
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Germany on 22 December 2020

Review: Entspricht nicht der Konfiguration

ProductName: Columbia Men's Fast Trek Fleece Vest
Review: Columbia Men Fleece Vest Fast Trek:  buono  il capo,  un  po'  meno  la  cerniera.Smanicato  in  pile a  collo  alto,  da  mezza  stagione,  vestibilità  regular,  disegnato  come  capo  esterno, molto  morbido e  discreto,  utilizzabile  anche  come  gilet  da  mettere sotto il  giaccone.Due  ampie  tasche  frontali e  una  Napoleon sul  petto  per  lo  smartphone,  tutte  con  zip;  low  in  lavatrice  e  asciugatura  naturaleMolto  scomoda  la  chiusura;  premesso  che  sono  già  abituato  alle cerniere  all'americana,  con  aggancio  sulla  sinistra,  ma  questa  è  proprio  cervellotica  e  ci  vuole  un  attimo  per  indovinare  la  manovra.Buono  il  prezzo (scontato),  secondo  me  derivante  dal fatto  che  è  un  fine  serie  (infatti  mi  pare  che  sia  in  esaurimento  anche sul  sito  della  Columbia).Eccellente,  al  solito,  la  Prime  con  domiciliazione, se  volete,  sul  Locker.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Italy on 27 November 2020

ProductName: Columbia Men's Fast Trek Fleece Vest
Review: I like it. I bought the size L for a snug fit (44 inch chest) over a polo-shirt  when bike riding in the morning or evening chill. It's great for the task. Flexible and snug but not too tight. The thing is I would like to buy a size XL too for other occasions but I notice the price of the XL at this review date in early June 2022 is £40.63 when all the other sizes, even the XXL, are priced around the £28 mark. There can surely be no justification for "discounting" (hmmn..) all sizes except one  ..perhaps the size that sells the most?  Needless to say I won't be buying an XL unless the discrepancy disappears. Otherwise though a great feeling, soft & flexible product that I recommend.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 June 2022

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large
Review: High quality product.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the Netherlands on 2 October 2022

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large
Review: Ottimo prodotto, tiene veramente caldo. Leggermente lungo, ma con gli elastici è possibile stringere la vita e fare un risvoltino. Veste grande, io sono alto 1,88m x 90kg e va bene la taglia L.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Italy on 29 December 2023

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large
Review: Muy ligero y calienta bien
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Spain on 4 December 2023

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large
Review: Very light but give me enough warm in Breezy days. Fit perfectly no gimmick of the quality of Colombia products. Reasonable price and definitely recommend it.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 August 2023

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large
Review: I really like the look on this vest. It is great for fall/early winter. I sized up a bit (L instead of M) and it still provides a great fit.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 28 December 2023

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large
Review: I sent this back as it was toooooo o big for me. I would say it fits slightly bigger than you expect, which you want as you may want to wear a jumper under it but I went a full size up and it was a tent on me.It's actually quite long too which I am not sure I liked. There is some sort of lining in this too which means it basically reflects your body heat back at you and helps to retain it, you are your own heating. It's a good idea but I would think that unless it is many minus degrees this would be complete overkill in most of the UK. Best for very cold temps.Overall though from what I saw of it the quality seems decent and the design is fine except for the general sizing weirdness
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 October 2021

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large
Review: I am a big fan of Columbia vests. They are lightweight and I don't even feel like I'm wearing them, even in the cold season. I really like them and the price I paid on Black Friday was amazing. Please keep the prices low so that I can purchase more.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 4 December 2023

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large
Review: Ottimo prodotto, caldo grazie al suo rivestimento interno. Forse un po lungo, taglie comode.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Italy on 26 February 2023

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large
Review: Mido 1,85 y peso 82 kilos . No tengo barriga. Pedí la talla L. Me queda bien pero creo que una talla menos me quedaría mejor. Más ceñida al cuerpo. La talla L para mi gusto queda un poquito larga y un poquito ancha. Pero con una sudadera debajo queda bien.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Spain on 8 November 2023

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large
Review: Gilet con ottimi materiali, soprattutto la fodera interna con materiale che mantiene il calore.Un po’ troppo lungo, finisce sotto la vita è se hai cose in tasca resta scomodo
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Italy on 8 May 2023

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large
Review: Overall this is a decent padded vest - it stays warm in cooler temps and is fairly lightweight. The odd issue is that it's very long for a men's vest. I wear a Large, and I'm 6 feet tall but this vest goes past my butt and ends at my upper thighs. I double checked to see if I got a Tall version by mistake but the size is just a standard L, so it's the design of the garment that is about four inches longer than comparable vests for men.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 16 January 2024

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large
Review: Nice looking gilet, sizing is fitted so choose your size bearing in mind it will an outside layer. Really warm with huge zipped outside pockets, inside pockets also large. Light weight and costed roughly half what other sports retailers were Great value.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 January 2022

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large
Review: Awesome vest, very warm and light to wear. Got a good price for it!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 10 April 2023

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large
Review: Really chuffed with this - the shiny/reflective inside material really seemed effective, feeling warmer than you'd think for the thickness. Not sure I'd want to do any physical activity in it for the same reason (would imagine overheating), but great for general use.For size ref, I'm 5'10", fit-ish 13 stone (not fat), and got a large. It was great for going over a few layers/hoodie, but would be too big if just going over one or two thin layers. Would get a medium for that. It's also quite long in the body.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 March 2022

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large
Review: Habe den Artikel aufgrund einer Empfehlung im Freundeskreis bestellt. Was soll ich sagen. Beste Weste für mich. Sehr leicht und die Omni Heat Technologie von Columbia ist top. Obwohl beim Tragen aussen alles kühl ist, fühlt man sich beim Tragen schön gewärmt. Aber ab -5 Grad sollte man sich mehr drunterziehen oder auf eine Jacke wechseln ;-)  ansonsten 5 Sterne.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in Germany on 23 December 2021

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large
Review: This is a great quality body warmer from columbia. It is a little on the big side but . If you want to wear it with just a t shirt underneath I recommend ordering a size below.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 August 2023

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large
Review: I originally ordered the Columbia Voodo 590 vest in large. Read all the reviews. Knew there was an issue with the vest running large. I'm 6'2'' and 198 lbs. Lean, no paunch. The large was too big. There were gaps at the shoulders and under the arms. A vest has to be reasonably snug or there's no point in wearing it. Had tried the Columbia Powder Lite in a couple of stores but they only had camo. Ordered it in large, black. Fits perfectly; warm. Runs a little long but that's fine. Seems to be as warm as the Voodo and cheaper.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 8 December 2021

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large
Review: Not a lot to write about.Plain and boring design, doesn't look unique or special.I've returned it immediately after trying it on.There are much better looking other there.A slim fit would have made a big difference
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 October 2021

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large
Review: Got this for spring golf and love it. Freedom of movement is great. I take it off when I’m ready to swing a club. Have been using it all fall in this winter. Was such a better deal then some over priced brand names (it’s an insulated vest) those other brands are not worth $150.

ProductName: Columbia Men's Powder Lite Vest, Black, Large

En este modelo de chaqueta la L se queda muy larga de mangas y anchísima y la M se ajusta más de mangas y pecho pero en cintura pasa a ser estrecha. Un desastre. Columbia tiene un lío entre modelos de chaquetas y otras prendas que hace que siempre tengas que probar porque no hay dos tallas que queden igual de bien. Por lo demás, es una chaqueta bastante fina a poner o debajo de otra (por eso se llama "down") o a usar con poco frío.

ProductName: Betty Dain Premier Barber Jacket, M, Black
Review: Nice quality barber jacket. It is nice and lightweight with a zipper front. The two pockets on the front are very convenient to carry the shop phone. It is true to size. Ordered using Amazon prime and received it the next day. I have nothing but good things to say about the barber jacket.  The zipper is sturdy and should last a long while. The lightweight nylon makes it comfortable and not to bulky while I am cutting hair all day. Great jacket.

ProductName: Betty Dain Premier Barber Jacket, M, Black

ProductName: Betty Dain Premier Barber Jacket, M, Black

ProductName: Betty Dain Premier Barber Jacket, M, Black
Review: I am by no means a barber, but I do cut a lot of hair on a weekly basis. Before I bought this jacket I was using nothing and it bothered me that I got so much hair on myself from cutting hair after a long day at my normal job. I wanted to order something that not only kept the hair off me, but provided that "Barber" feel to my customers with a couple pockets to keep my brush and comb in. I found this on Amazon and it fit perfectly. The color in the picture is true-to-life. Now when I cut hair, people compliment me on how much I look like a real barber and I am very satisfied after removing the jacket...no more hairs!!!!
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 1 September 2012

ProductName: Betty Dain Premier Barber Jacket, M, Black

ProductName: Betty Dain Premier Barber Jacket, M, Black

ProductName: Betty Dain Premier Barber Jacket, M, Black
Review: I'm not a barber, but I work with dogs that shed enough to make a full body suite for an entire bald Saint Bernard. I used to wear hospital scrubs, but even those are not very easy to remove all the hair from. I wanted something that I can just zip up over a T-shirt and comfortably wear all day. Well, not only is it great for that, but hair comes right off with ease. Now, I can go home without taking some of the dog hair from the day with me. I LOVE THIS THING!

ProductName: Red Kap Men's Slash Pocket Jacket, Navy, Small
Review: This is the best lightweight jacket you can buy. The best at being light but keeping your warm. Most automotive shops have this jacket with their logo/badge on it and their uniform color. This jacket could use an inside pocket or two, but that's not a legitimate reason to complain. This jacket is good for work and for casual wear. It resists dust and oil better than any other jacket I have tried. It also looks great when washed and washes easily in the washer. It is a polyester blend, so it does not shrink. Like all clothes, I wash before wearing, and I recommend you do for this because it will soften the cotton portion of the material. It also will remove any chemical smells to make the jacket obviously smell better. I could sleep in this jacket it is that comfortable. I cannot recommend this jacket enough. If it had inside pockets, then this would be the perfect jacket. I would even wear it in the summer for my EDC if it had inside pockets.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 6 July 2023

ProductName: Red Kap Men's Slash Pocket Jacket, Navy, Small
Review: I like the fit and feel of the jacket. I'll wear it in thorny brush and expect it will hold up well. It lacks an inside chest pocket; I valued the one in the jacket this one replaces. This one also lacks a hanging loop inside the collar. It tends to slide off the hook I hang it on. The jacket's upper arms are roomy and don't bind.UPDATE: In its first field outing, this jacket slid well through the prickly roundleaf greenbrier. It snagged some on raspberry canes and multiflora rose stems, but the shell fabric didn't tear. With all the polyester in the thread, the fabric has a more slippery hand than 100% cotton canvas would, but it resists tears and "picks" almost as well. I'm pleased with it.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 19 March 2023

ProductName: Red Kap Men's Slash Pocket Jacket, Navy, Small
Review: Like everything, dislike nothing.  Suitable for all but coldest weather.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 5 December 2023

Review: This quality of this coat is great for the money. I am a short stocky big guy (3xl) and certain coats do not fit. I sadly returned mine for the following reasons. 1. Shoulders were to wide for my build. Also the cuffs were to small around my wrists. Fit well around my gut however. Also my buddy has the same one and it fits his build perfectly. ProductName: Red Kap Men's Slash Pocket Jacket, Navy, Small
