ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 22 November 2023

ProductName: Red Kap Men's Slash Pocket Jacket, Navy, Small
Review: I received my first jacket at my job. 7 years of being my go to jacket, it has been great spring and fall. Winter time on top of a nice hoodie and thermal shirt, you're good to go.Not overly thick but that's what I like most. It is still plenty warm and blocks wind and light rain. It is comfortable enough to become my cats favorite nap spot so I'll take her word on that.For 7 years of use, I still use it, have only had to replace 2 plastic buttons over the years, both on right sleeve which I use more, so that's understandable. Plenty of other buttons on jacket you don't really need so use one of those for the important one if it breaks. I wash it in washing machine and dry in dryer, nothing fancy just throw it in with other clothes. It is actually remarkable how well it has held up, which inspired me to order my own without the work insignia or my name sewn on. And in a color I wanted. I checked the label on my work coat, saw Red Kap, and started my Amazon search to find the right one (slash pocket jacket) I already knew a large fit me perfect (6' 0" 165lbs) and honestly the price was about 1/3 of what I expected, as it has outlasted way pricier jackets (Carhartt).  Only improvement would be a zipper pocket on the inside since slash pockets have a habit of spilling my phone but I can work around that. Redd Kap has gained a faithful fan, may not buy too much since they last so long, but will recommend to anyone anytime. Heck, look at the photos, blue is 7 years old and grey is my new one. Almost no difference after A LOT of use.
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 26 October 2020

ProductName: Red Kap Men's Slash Pocket Jacket, Navy, Small
Review: Nice item. Fits well
ReviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on 1 December 2023

ProductName: Red Kap Men's Slash Pocket Jacket, Navy, Small
Review: The best thing about this jacket: Not bulky but warm and the fit.Worn this two weeks straight now.  I am 6' 6" and have always needed an extra large to get the sleeves to be long enough but in reality, I would take a large.  So I ordered a Large Tall and it fits perfectly.Warmer than your lighter windbreaker jackets but not heavy like your snow jacket.  Light but warm.  I was at a gas station getting gas on a windy night and was surprised at how I did not feel the chill on my upper body.There is one thing I don't care for but not a deal breaker for me. The cuffs have buttons but I don't use them as even the one that has the largest opening, I can't slide my hand through (I would have to unbutton every time to take off).  So I just leave it unbuttoned.

ProductName: Red Kap Men's Slash Pocket Jacket, Navy, Small

The cut looks great, I am a little chunky right now so how it cuts in at the waist is perfect for hiding the gut. It is lose enough to easily move around in and be active if needed, I was a little afraid of it being too "work" looking, but it is not, looks great out to dinner or for hitting the beach on a walk. I went with a 3XL long and I cannot be any more satisfied. I’ve gotten several compliments and it is a great mid weight jacket that’s not too hot. It’s also not so bulky that it impedes on anything I may be doing which I love. Can’t stand swimming in a bulky jacket!

The color is nice too. I don't think it will hold up as well as my old jacket but it keeps me warm and is comfortable, which I suppose is all I can ask for in a jacket. Even though I bought the same size the newer one runs far bigger than the older one, the sleeves are looser around the upper arm and the chest is way puffier. The outside material is the same, but the lining is different and seems easier to tear. Overall I give this a 7/10

ProductName: Red Kap Men's Slash Pocket Jacket, Navy, Small

The quilted inside is super warm, perfect fall jacket. Jacket sits just below the waist which gives a nice cropped look.Cons: the sleeves are massive. Like almost comedically big. But that said it allows for a lot of flexibility when working/moving. There were also a lot of loose threads all around the jacket. Not surprising given the price and it’s easy enough to go around it with scissors to clean it up.Way cheaper than Dickie’s Eisenhower and maybe only 0.5 lower on the quality scale. Not much to lose since it’s only $40Sizing: 5’ 10”- bought a medium
